masterClauseA: A Person Influenced by an Obligation
A Person Subjected to Adverse Conditions
A Person Influenced by the Occult and the Mysterious
masterClauseC: Pays a grim penalty in an unfortunate undertaking,
Emerges happily from a serious entanglement.
Foils a guilty plotter and defeats a subtle plot.
Undertakes a role that leads straight to catastrophe.
Emerges from a trying ordeal with sorely garnered wisdom.
Makes the supreme sacrifice in carrying out an undertaking.
Reverses certain opinions when their fallacy is revealed.
Achieves success and happiness in a hard undertaking.
Meets with an experience whereby an error is corrected
Discovers the folly of trying to appear otherwise than as one is in reality.
Rescues integrity from a serious entanglement.
Comes finally to the blank wall of enigma.
Achieves a complete and permanent character transformation
Meets any fate, good or evil.

masterClauseB.description: Engaging in a Difficult Enterprise When Promised a Reward for High Achievement
Falling in Love at a Time when Certain Obligations Forbid Love
Seeking to Demonstrate the Power of Love by a Test of Courage
Being Impelled by Inordinate Fancy to Exercise Mistaken Judgment in a Love Affair
Becoming Involved in a Hopeless Love Affair, and Seeking to Make the Best of a Disheartening Situation
Challenging, in a Quest of Love, the Relentless Truth that “East is East, and West is West, and never the twain shall meet”
Becoming Involved in a Love Affair that Encounters Unforeseen Obstacles
Confronting a Situation in Which Wealth is Made Conditional Upon a Certain Course of Action in a Love Affair
Being Put to a Test in Which Love Will be Lost if More Material Fortunes are Advanced
Suffering an Estrangement Due to Mistaken Judgment
Confronting a Situation in Which Courage and Devotion Alone Can Save the Fortunes of One Beloved
Falling into Misfortune through Disloyalty in Love
Seeking by Craftiness to Escape Misfortune
Falling Into Misfortune Through the Wiles of a Crafty Schemer
Finding a Sustaining Power in Misfortune
Being Delivered from Misfortune by One who in Confidence Confesses a Secret of Transgression
Bearing Patiently with Misfortunes and Seeking to Attain Cherished Aims Honorably
Rebelling against a Power that Controls Personal Abilities and Holds them in Subjection
Meeting with Misfortune and Being Cast Away in a Primitive, Isolated, and Savage Environment
Becoming Involved with Conditions in Which Misfortune is Indicated
Becoming Invoived with Conditions in Which Misfortune is Indicated
Following a Wrong Course through Mistaken Judgment
Becoming Involved in a Complication that has to do with Mistaken Judgment and Suspicion
Becoming the Victim of Mistaken Judgment in Carrying out an Enterprise
Seeking to Save a Person who is Accused of Transgression
Seeking Secretly to Preserve Another from Danger
Refusing to Betray Another’s Secret and Calmly Facing Persecution Because of the Refusal
Facing a Situation in which the Misfortunes of One Greatly Esteemed Call for Courage and Sagacious Enterprise
Aiding Another to Hide from the World a Fateful Secret
Enlisting Whole-Heartedly in the Service of a Needy Unfortunate and Conferring Aid of the Utmost Value
Living a Lonely, Cheerless Life and Seeking Companionship
Seeking to Conceal Identity Because of a Lofty Idealism
Resisting Secretly and from an Honorable Motive a Mandate Considered Discreditable
Embarking Upon an Enterprise of Insurrection in the Hope of Ameliorating Certain Evil Conditions
Becoming Involved in a Complication that Challenges the Value of Cherished Ideals
Undergoing an Experience that Results in a Remarkable Character Change
Seeking Against Difficulties to Realize a Cherished Ideal
Committing a Grievous Mistake and Seeking in Secret to Live Down Its Evil Results
Forsaking Cherished Ambitions to Carry Out an Obligation
Embarking Upon an Enterprise in which One Obligation is Opposed by Another Obligation
Finding an Obligation at Variance with Ambition, Inclination or Necessity
Falling Into Misfortune While Seeking Honorably to Discharge an Obligation
Seeking to Overcome Personal Limitations in Carrying Out an Enterprise
Seeking by Unusual Methods to Conquer Personal Limitations
Seeking to Forward an Enterprise and Encountering Family Sentiment as an Obstacle
Seeking Retaliation for a Grievous Wrong that is Either Real or Fancied
Finding (Apparently) an Object Greatly Coveted, and Obtaining (Apparently) the Object
Assuming the Character of a Criminal in a Perfectly Honest Enterprise
Assuming a Fictitious Character When Embarking  Upon a Certain Enterprise
Being Impelled by an Unusual Motive to Engage in Crafty Enterprise
Devising a Clever and Plausible Delusion in Order to Forward Certain Ambitious Plans
Encountering a Would-Be Transgressor and Seeking to Prevent a Transgression
Opposing the Plans of a Crafty Schemer
Becoming Involved in a Puzzling Complication that Has to do with an Object Possessing Mysterious Powers
Becoming Involved in a Mysterious Complication and Seeking to Make the Utmost of a Bizarre Experience
Seeking to Test the Value of a Mysterious Communication and Becoming Involved in Weird Complexities
Seeking to Unravel a Puzzling Complication
Engaging in an Enterprise and then Mysteriously Disappearing
Engaging in a Mysterious Enterprise and Becoming Involved with the Occult and the Fantastic
Becoming Involved, Through Curiosity Aroused by Mystery, in a Strange Enterprise
Becoming Aware of an Important Secret that Calls for Decisive Action

characters.A-3: male rival or enemy of A
characters.A-9: male superior, employer, one in authority
characters.B-3: female rival or enemy of B
characters.B-9: female superior, employer. one in authority
characters.AX: a mysterious male person, or one of unusual character
characters.BX: a mysterious female person, or one of unusual character
characters.X: an inanimate object, an object of mystery, an uncertain quantity

5.description: A, carrying the news of the death of his friend, A-2, to B, the girl to whom A-2 was betrothed, 70 ch A to A-2, is mistaken by B and her parents for A-2. B and her parents have never seen A-2 or A 26a, b * A, posing as his dead friend, A-2, falls in love with B, and withholds the news of A-2’s death **

18.description: A falls in love with B; but A already has a wife, B-3. whom he has never loved, a wife whom he considers it his duty to care for

21.description: A meets B and thinks she is a transgressor; and B, on her part, thinks A is a transgressor * A and B, each thinking the other is a transgressor, nevertheless fall in love **

25.description: A, falling in love with B 32 38, whom he does not know, seeks an introduction

27.description: B, unworthy, wins the love of worthy A, and tense complications result

29.description: B knows nothing of A, having fallen in love with him at “first sight”

30.description: B, a stenographer, is in love with A, junior partner of the firm employing her

31.description: B, rescued from an accident by A, whom she does net know, falls in love with him

32.description: B, desiring love, has never had a lover, and feels the misfortune keenly

33.description: B, daughter of M-B, a widow, desperately opposes, and for very good reasons, M-B’s intention to marry again

34.description: B, humble and self-effacing, worships A, her love alone seeming a sufficient reward of happiness

35.description: B, a plain girl who has no lover, is persuaded by her friend, B-2, to accept an escort to a dance—A, a man she does not know

36.description: B is attractive, but no man pays her any attention * B, attractive, and humiliated because of her lack of admirers, resorts to simulation to gain contentment **

37.description: B, middle-aged, loves and is beloved by A, a youth

38.description: B considers love and marriage the great adventure, and eagerly proceeds with them

39.description: B, unmarried, cherishes motherhood as her ideal

carryOns: 828 tr A & B & ch B-5 to A-5
43.description: A, in love with B, quarrels with F-B, father of B * B’s father, F-B, is mysteriously slain, and innocent A is arrested for the crime **

46.description: A meets B, his love of other days, and is surprised to find that his success in distant lands 967 has no charm for her that is not discounted by the meager opportunities of the home country

carryOns: 284 ch B to D & A-3 to A-8
313 ch F-B to A, B to D-A, A to A-3 & A-3 to A-8
48.description: A knew very well that he would suffer adversity all his life when, in order to cancel an obligation he gave his daughter, D-A, in marriage to A-8, a man she did not love

49.description: A and B, lovers, meet with tragic misfortune but escape death * A and B, lovers, escaping death in a tragic misfortune, each believes the other has perished **

50.description: A, in love with B, impersonates another person at B’s instigation * A’s pretentions accepted, it develops that the person impersonated has a wife, who immediately claims A as her husband **

53.description: A loves B; B dies; and A becomes demented through grief * A thinks B has merely gone away for a time, and spends years in a vain search for her **

55.description: A really loves B, although he has taken vows that prohibit love for woman. A lives to regret his vows

56.description: B is cconvinced that several eligible men are in love with her * B is unaware of the fact that she is the victim of egotistical self-deception **

57.description: B, in a fit of discouragement over an unhappy love affair, meditates suicide and writes a note to her friends telling of her motives * B, contemplating suicide, writes a note explaining her motives; then she changes her mind—and loses the note **

59.description: B, aristocratic, wealthy, romantic, falls in love with A, a designing rogue masquerading as a person of “quality”

60.description: B is abandoned by A, the man with whom she eloped

61.description: B, in male attire, is suddenly revealed to A, the man she loves, in her true sex

62.description: B is harrassed by gossip concerning men falsely rumored to be in love with her, and by relatives of the supposed lovers calling on her and making complaint

63.description: B, in love with A, sends A a gift which, she mistakenly thinks, will forward their mutual happiness

64.description: B is persuaded into a secret marriage by A, the man she loves

65.description: B is so fully aware of the fact that she is beautiful and attractive that she thinks every man is in love with her * A, whom B favors but who does not love her, seeks B out and bluntly tells her of her egotistical self-deception

67.description: A, elderly, wealthy, is in love with youthful B.* A seeks by a stratagem to discover the sincerity of B’s professed love for him **

68.description: A wronged B, the woman he loved, but secretly; and A craftily retains his own high place in society while leaving B to bear the heartache and shame alone

69.description: A, in love with B and thinking B has committed a crime 1172 1206 1292 1293a, b, c. declares to the police that he committed the crime himself

70.description: A’s family is at war with B’s family; and A, in love with B, disguises his identity when calling on B

72.description: A, in love with B, pretends to be his deceased friend, A-2 26a, b ch A to A-2 who was betrothed to B. B and her family, hearing of A-2’s death at last, believe A to be the spectre of A-2

73.description: A and B are in love, but B’s parents, F-B and M-B, do not favor A; and A and B plan to elope, marry, and then seek forgiveness of B’s people

76.description: A and A-3 are rivals for the hand of B. A-3 plans to forward his own aims at A’s expense

77.description: A and A-3 are in love with B 85a. F-B, father of B, seeks to discover by secret enterprise which lover is the more worthy

78.description: A and A-3, in love with B, are persuaded by capricious B to undertake a dangerous enterprise to prove their love

79.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, pretends to be A’s friend in order to lure him into an undertaking in which he will lose his reputation or his life

81.description: A kidnaps his sweetheart, B, 206 284 311 from an automobile while she is on her way to marry A-3, A’s rival in love

83.description: B pretends that she is engaged to be married in order to be free of certain annoying experiences

86.description: B, unmarried and impelled by an unusual motive, pretends that she is engaged to be married to a fictitious person, AX, and has the announcement published in a newspaper

87.description: B disguises herself as a boy, in order to be near A, whom she secretly adores

88.description: B, in order to carry out an enterprise considered necessary, offers to sell herself in marriage to the highest bidder

89.description: B, thinking a symbol of lost love, X 1384, has a magic power of its own, seeks to regain love by wearing the symbol

91.description: B, in love with A, seeks to save A from disaster 595 608 610 by shrewd enterprise

92.description: B is in love with A, who has been arrested on a criminal charge by A-6 753 1084 1101 * B, in order to help her lover, A, escape from A-6, the officer who has arrested him, makes love to A-6 **

95.description: B will lose her lover, A, if she allows A to proceed with an enterprise 225 125a 1201 1267a 1278a instigated by herself. To avoid losing A, B defeats the enterprise by making a confession

96.description: A betrays B and does not marry her as he promised

97.description: A, in love with B, seeks to save B, by secret enterprise and at any cost from threatening misfortune

98.description: A is one of the “idle rich”, who craftily retains his high place in society in spite of the fact that he has secretly betrayed a young woman B

99.description: A and B, both unmarried, enter into a business association. They covenant and agree that love between them shall be taboo

100.description: A, in love with B, is determined to see B, although the determination will surely involve him in misfortune unless he resorts to crafty enterprise

102.description: B is falsely suspected of being in love with various men. She decides to free herself of the suspicion by a stratagem

103.description: B is in doubt as to which of her many lovers are in love with her money, rather than with her, and she resolves to settle the doubt by secret enterprise

104.description: B, if she wins a certain contest, also wins A-3, a lover of wealth and distinction whom she does not love, although she does love riches and social prominence; and if she loses the contest, she wins A, a poor lover whom she does love

leadIns: 585 ch “wife of A” to “sweetheart of A”
105.description: A believes that his sweetheart, B, is dead; and B, at a distance, learns of this mistaken belief on A’s part

106.description: A is a crabbed, disagreeable person whose misfortune it is to find no pleasure in life * A, a crabbed, disagreeable person, falls in love with B 4a 9a, b and, under the inspiration of love, his character undergoes a transformation **

107.description: A’s little world seems to crumble about his ears when he fancies that his sweetheart, B, is false to him * A, discovering that B is still true to him, undergoes a character transformation; pep, persistency and eloquence return, and lead him to success and happiness **

108.description: A, sweetheart of B, is condemned to die for a transgression he did not commit * A, unjustly imprisoned, is pardoned and restored to liberty when B appeals to high authority, A-9 **

109.description: A loses his sweetheart, loses his liberty on a false charge 43 747 731 623 608, escapes prison and survives shipwreck 650 686 688 690, at last to reach the island where great treasure is buried 1394 1369 1403 1436 1406 ; 1408 1383. And he recovers the treasure

110.description: A, in love with B, is promised her hand in marriage if he will: [1] successfully accomplish a work of great difficulty 209 225 111 112 113 114 115 [2] demonstrate his ability by securing a position at a salary which the parents of B think necessary for her comfort and happiness 1374 1377b; or, [3] solve a puzzling mystery

111.description: A, in love with B, is required by F-B, father of B, to secure a certain amount of money before he will be seriously considered as a son-in-law

112.description: A loves B; and B’s father, F-B, promises him B’s hand in marriage if he will carry out successfully an enterprise of great difficulty and danger

113.description: A, in love with B, struggles to accumulate enough money to be able to marry

114.description: B informs A, the man she loves, that he will lose her love unless he overcomes his lack of enterprise and makes the determination to win his dominant trait

115.description: B is in love with A; but, before she will promise to marry him, she stipulates that he must do big work, wonderfully big work

116.description: A loses wealth by marrying B against the wishes of a rich relative, who disinherits him

leadIns: 1432 ch A to F-A & NW to A
117.description: A, a wanderer, is left a fortune by F-A, his father, in case he can be found and will marry BX. a woman he has never seen

leadIns: 1432 ch A to GF-A & NW to A
118.description: A will be disinherited by his wealthy grandfather, GF-A, if he does not perform an act which will prove a grievous injury to F-B 276 ch F-A to GF-A, father of B, the woman A loves

leadIns: 476b ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
477 ch A to A-8 & A-2 to A
carryOns: 400 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
418 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
119.description: A, unmarried, elopes with B, the wife of his dearest friend, A-2

leadIns: 409 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
120.description: A, unmarried, falls in love with married B; B’s husband, A-8, will not divorce B, nor will she divorce him

121.description: B, unmarried, seeks motherhood because of a lofty ideal that does not shrink from public censure

122.description: A and A-3 are both in love with B 84 235 280. A seeks to protect A-3 from arrest

123.description: A, to protect a parent, F-A, is compelled to take measures aginst F-B, father of B, the girl A loves

carryOns: 11a ch B to B-3 & M-B to B
124.description: B is older than A and feels that it will be unjust to permit A to marry her, although she dearly loves him * B suffers remorse after rejecting A’s love **

126.description: B, sweetheart of A, persuades A to seek wealth by transgression

leadIns: 494 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
carryOns: 558 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
128.description: A, in love with B, discovers that B is married to A-8

carryOns: 402 ch A to A-3 & A-3 to A
129.description: A and B are in love; but certain unhappy conditions prevent the cherished culmination of their romance

130.description: A is on his way to marry B and has only a few hours before the ceremony. He meets with misfortune

131.description: A is so much in love with B that his business languishes and he devotes all his time to courtship

132.description: A, if he carries out a certain obligation, will be unfaithful to B, and will lose her love

133.description: A loves B, and is compelled to stand helplessly by while B undertakes a dangerous enterprise

135.description: A and his father, F-A, are both in love with B and wish to marry her

136.description: A and A-3 are in love with B *. Obliged to carry out the orders of A-3, A is commanded to [1] commit suicide, or [2] to leave the field clear for A-3 **

138.description: A, engaged to marry B, receives a request from B-3, his former sweetheart, that he come and see her

139.description: A discovers that his best friend, A-2, is in love with B, the girl A is seeking to marry

140.description: A and B, associating in platonic friendship, find that love will not be denied

141.description: B, in love with A, has worn A’s engagement ring for years

142.description: B, in love with A, discovers secretly that A no longer loves her, although he is willing to marry her as he has promised

143.description: B has so many lovers that she has no time to give to any one or anything else

144.description: B, in the hands of enemies of A 616 719 is being forced to do their bidding 666 1010 by threats of violence against A, the man she loves

145.description: B, an attractive girl, is so absorbed in serious pursuits that she subordinates everything else, even love, to her high ambition

carryOns: 884a ch A to B & A-5 to A-3
146.description: B loves A; but A’s rival, A-3, makes a captive of B 81 tr A & A-3 and intends compelling her to marry him

147.description: B shares with her sweetheart, A, an important secret which, if revealed, would bring misfortune to B

148.description: A, because of his romantic surroundings 197 210-1, imagines himself in love with B

149.description: A, a widower, elderly, wealthy, temporarily bewitched by the vernal season, imagines himself in love with B, a servant in his own household

leadIns: 476a ch A to A-2 & A-3 to A
150.description: A, unmarried, elopes with B 405 ch A to A-2 477 tr A & A-2 ; 403 ch A to A-2 ; 468 ch A to A-2 ; 781 the wife of his best friend, A-2; then B leaves A to elope with A-3

151.description: A, fancying himself in love with B, corrects the error when his fancy is discredited

153.description: A, in love with B, has a valuable gift sent to B by a jeweler. * Through error, or by evil intent, packages are transposed; and the gift received by B, as from A, very nearly proves disastrous to A’s love affair **

155.description: AX, a gay young blade traveling through the country, takes refuge from a storm in a rural church. To his astonishment, he is hailed at once as a bridegroom, and is hurried to the altar where a pretty girl, B 38 166 in an exhausted condition, seems waiting for him. In a spirit of recklessness 421 ch A to AX, he allows himself to be married to her; and when she, after the ceremony, seems to realize that he is not the man she thought he was, he hurriedly makes his escape

156.description: A, a pretender, in love with B, secretly discovers B making fun of his pretentions; he retires from the scene in disgust, hurt and indignant, and gives B up

157.description: A and A-3, once bosom friends, become enemies through their rivalry for the love of B

158.description: A’s rival for the hand of B, A-3, is more energetic and enterprising than A and seems to be more favored

159.description: A is in love with B and does not know he has a more favored rival, A-3

160.description: A has a rival in love, A-3, whose assurance is the key to his extraordinary resourcefulness

161.description: A discovers that a certain “charm,” X, with which he has won success in love, is no charm at all. The person who gave him the charm tells him that faith in it is all that counts. Let a man be sure of himself, with or without a charm, and he is bound to conquer love

163.description: B learns that her lover, A, has fallen into desperate misfortune

164.description: B, a rich widow, has so many suitors she finds it difficult to make a choice

165.description: B loses her watch (or a locket), and has her lovers search for it. The picture of A, the lover B favors, is in the watch

166.description: B, running away from home to marry A, arrives in an exhausted condition at the church where she is to meet A. Scarcely realizing what is going on, she is married to a man who, as her senses clear, she discovers is not A but AX 155. She swoons on making the discovery, and AX disappears

168.description: A, and his friend, A-2, traveling together, meet with a tragic accident in which A-2 is killed. Before he dies, A-2 requests A to carry the news of his death to his sweetheart, B 130 ch A to A-2 112 ch A to A-2 175 ch A-3 to A-2. A proceeds with his mission

169.description: A falls in with his friend, A-2, who is on his way to meet B, a girl he has never seen but to whom he is betrothed * A and A-2 meet with a tragic adventure and A-2 is killed **

170.description: A and B, lovers, have a violent quarrel, and B returns a gift, X, she has received from A

171.description: A, a humble lover, has a rival for the love of B—A-3 75b 899 ch A to A-3 925 -* who is cultured, polished and a man of the world

172.description: B, estranged from her lover, A, whom she dearly loves, sends a telegram to another person and unconsciously puts A’s name and address at the top of it

173.description: B wore a certain ornament when her false lover, A, proposed to her. She has an odd conviction that the same misfortune will befall any other woman who wears the ornament

174.description: A and A-3, rivals in love, agree to meet at a certain hour, call on B, and ask her to choose between them

175.description: B puts the love of two suitors, A and A-3, to the test

177.description: A mistakenly believes that F-B, the father of B, the girl he loves, is his enemy

carryOns: 1164 ch A to F-B & A-8 to A
178.description: B promises to meet A, her lover, at her home and introduce him to her parents. A, arriving in advance of B, is mistaken for A-7, a man who is expected to call and apply for the position of butler

180.description: A, a man of great strength and skill, is in love with B, F-B, father of B, sure of A’s prowess and proud of it, in order to lure the champion of a rival clan, A-3, into a wrestling match with A 726b, offers the hand of B to the victor of the bout

183.description: B, while in an irresponsible state of mind, promises to marry A-3 1d 239 ch A to A-3; and later, realizing what she has done, regrets the promise

184.description: B takes the opposite meaning of an ambiguous sentence and accepts A’s statement 196 288 as a proposal of marriage

185.description: A is in love with B and is determined to ask her to marry him, but B is so closely guarded that A is in despair because of his lack of opportunity * A seeks by subtlity to make an opportunity to ask B to marry him **

186.description: A, in order to rescue B, who is ill and without funds, pretends to be in love with her and proposes marriage

187.description: A, in love with B and wishing to propose marriage, finds it impossible because B is so busy he can never find her alone. He seeks to make an opportunity by stratagem

189.description: B, asked by A to marry him, wants a little more light on A’s character before making up her mind * B challenges A to a contest of skill, her acceptance or rejection to be determined by the result **

190.description: B, not in love with A, for certain reasons proposes to A, not in love with B

191.description: A, seeking desperately his chance to propose marriage to B, rescues her from drowning, and proposes while they are clinging to an overturned boat

193.description: A, in love with B but too backward and diffident to propose marriage, is horrified to hear a child, CH, who knows of his passion, propose to B on his behalf. * But A is overjoyed when B accepts **

195.description: B, out in a storm on a pitch-dark night, receives a proposal of marriage. Unable to see her lover, and scarcely able to hear him, she nevertheless accepts—and meets with a disagreeable surprise

196.description: A, because of timidity, is unable to ask B’s hand in marriage

197.description: A, threatened with death by savages, is offered his life by B, the ruler of the tribe, if he will marry her

198.description: A, of a proud old Southern family, impoverished in fortune, feels that he cannot ask wealthy B, with whom he is in love, to marry him

199.description: A is poor and crippled, and his pride will not suffer him to ask B, the woman he loves, to marry him

200.description: A, in love with B and eager to win her in marriage, procrastinates as a matter of habit in making the marriage proposal

201.description: A, fearing that B will refuse him, finds it impossible to propose marriage

202.description: A, in love with B, has reasons for not proposing marriage

203.description: A and B, in love, are each too diffident to make an avowal to the other

204.description: A is absent-minded * A asks B to marry him and forgets that he has done so **

205.description: A, winning the love of B 23a, b 34 250 in his youth, and casting it aside, goes searching for it in later years

206.description: A, in love with B, discovers that his rival, A-3, is unworthy. B seems to favor A-3

207.description: A suffers remorse for telling B that he was married when he was not * A did not think that he loved B, but later finds that he does **

208.description: A, in love with B, discovers that B is a confirmed coquette and is merely playing with him

209.description: A carries out successfully a very difficult enterprise when promised the hand of B in marriage by F-B, father of B * A, discovering secretly that B loves a rival, A-3, refuses to hold B to a promise of marriage made by F-B **

210.description: A, under abnormal conditions, falls in love with B; on returning to normal conditions, he sees B as she really is and his love fades. [1] A’s imagination errs in a high, mountainous country; on returning to sea level, the error is manifest, and he renounces it 148 150. [2] A’s imagination errs on the romantic side in spring; but, as summer advances, he corrects his mistaken fancy 149 151. [3] A believes B wealthy; on discovering that she is poor, his ardor cools 1e ; 59 ; 93a. [4] A’s romantic success is won with a love “charm”; on discovering that the charm is a humbug, romance evaporates

211.description: A, who has long cherished B in his heart as the loveliest and most perfect of her sex, returns home after a long absence and discovers that. B has become an immoral character

213.description: A and B are in love; but one of A’s employees, A-7, tells B of a (seeming) transgression that A has committed. B credits the story * A-7 is a mercenary of A-3, A’s rival in love **

214.description: A, in love with B, is persuaded by Old Dry-as-Dust, the sage, AX, to turn from love as from something evil

216.description: A is about to marry B-3. who has deceived him into thinking B, the woman he loves, is unfaithful

217.description: A’s rival for the love of B, A-3, basely deceives B with false suspicious of A

219.description: A, influenced by his maiden sisters, SR-A, SR-A, renounces his affair with B, the woman he loves

220.description: A’s friends, A-2, A-2, believe that B, whom A is about to marry, is a woman of immoral character and that A should be restrained

223.description: B’s father, F-B, a religious fanatic, sends B away from home because she falls in love with A 6a 14a. who is not of their religious belief

224.description: B, the woman A loves, proves false to him; and A fears B will reveal a secret 126 ; 1159 ; 1192 1165 ch A to A-8 & A-5 to A 923 that will cause him trouble if it becomes known

225.description: B awakens her lover, A, from his apathy by arousing his ambition to get ahead in the world—which results in disaster to her love

226.description: B, finding her supposed ideal lover, A 688 ; 307 296 324 discovers that A has “feet of clay” like all the rest.

227.description: B is unable to marry A because her father, F-B, in using B for his subject in a scientific experiment, has instilled a poison into her blood

228.description: B wears a rose in her hair to reveal her love for A, as A has requested * B wears a rose in her hair to reveal her love for A; but the rose, unnoticed by B, falls from its place; and when A sees her, he turns without a word and goes away **

229.description: B, of an inferior race, in seeking to win the love of A, of a superior lace, learns how hopeless is the task of challenging racial conventions

230.description: A, impelled by an unusual motive, pretends to fall in love with B * A pretends to fall in love with B, and ends his make-believe by really falling in love **

231.description: A hopes, by a surgical operation on his skull, to be made immune from the “master passion”

232.description: A is an aristocrat; and B, the woman he loves, is a “daughter of the people” and hates the aristocracy * A, an aristocrat, in love with a working girl, B, pretends to be a toiler **

233.description: A is in love with B, and they are to be married; but A leaves town mysteriously, no one knows what has become of him, and he does not return until after the time set for the wedding

235.description: A and A-3 158 100 are rivals for the hand of B. B secretly favors A, but because A is self-effacing and less enterprising than A-3, B pretends to favor A-3 in order to spur A into proving his worth and ability

236.description: A and A-3 59 ch A to A-3 are in love with B. B is about to marry A-3, whom A knows to be a crook * A induces his rival in love, A-3, to send B a certain gift, X; then, after X is sent. A proves that it was stolen by A-3 **

237.description: A, discovering that he is not a fugitive from justice as he had supposed, returns to his native country, secretly abandoning: B, for whom he had declared his love 12a while thinking himself a transgressor

238.description: A is engaged to marry B. B-3, a designing woman, seeks to compromise A 218a, b so B will give him up. B-2 is a generous woman who seeks by secret enterprise 844b to rescue A from the wiles of B-3 and restore him to B

239.description: B, poor, would marry wealthy A, whom she does not love, for the freedom from care his money would give her

240.description: B, revealing the fact that she is in love with A, of a family at war with her own, is denied further intercourse with A by her father, F-A * B meets A clandestinely **

241.description: B, in love with A, and disapproved of by F-A, the father of A, seeks as an Unknown to impress F-A with her character and charm

242.description: B disapproves of the men she meets in her own social and business world * B, disapproving of the men she meets in her own social and business world, envisions her ideal, the man she would like to meet, and fares forth secretly in search of him

243.description: B, in love with A, rejects his love when she learns that he jilted B-2 277 B’s dearest friend, to pay attentions to her

244.description: A fights against the blandishments of B 945c -*, a morally inferior woman who is in love with him

245.description: A is accused by A-3, his rival in love 157, of having been born under a “bar sinister”

carryOns: 1237a ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
1266 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
247.description: A betrays B, thinking mistakenly that there is no one to take her part and avenge the wrong

248.description: A, recognizing a relentless obligation, renounces B, with whom he is deeply in love

249.description: B, in love with A, rejects his love because she thinks him a man of evil mystery

250.description: B is in love with A, but A avoids women, believing them all tempters of Satan

251.description: B, denied love, seeks happiness in a mental personification of love

253.description: B is loved by wealthy A. B does not love A, but, for certain reasons, she yields to his importunities and marries him

254.description: B, although she loves A, realizes that she is not the intellectual equal of A, and that their marriage would prove a hindrance to him

255.description: A, with a taint of negro blood in his veins—known only to himself—loves and is beloved by B, a white girl

256.description: A, in love with B, leaves B for B-3, a woman who flatters his vanity and whose bold beauty has an appeal for him

258.description: A, in spite of the fact that there are reasons why he should not marry, nevertheless plans to do so

259.description: A, when B, the woman he loves, refuses to marry him, becomes [1] blase and cynical, a misogynist 224 230 243 245: [2] reckless, “goes to the dogs” or loses his mental balance in other ways 263 636 638 or [3] seeks to forget his unhappiness by indulging in a love for adventure

261.description: B, her life’s romance apparently wrecked, decides to marry the man, A-3 284 290, she does not love

263.description: B rejects A, an honorable lover, and accepts A-3, who is a knave * A becomes a crook **

264.description: B, in desperation and out of her great love, proposes marriage to A, and is rejected

266.description: A would save B, the woman he loves, from marriage with a rival, A-3, when he discovers A-3 to be a scoundrel

267.description: B, discovering the perfidious nature of A-3, the man she has promised to marry, turns from him to accept A, by whose shrewdness A-3 was unmasked

268.description: B refuses marriage with A, the man she loves, because of an obligation * B sacrifices happiness when, faithful to an obligation, she refuses marriage with A, the man she loves. Her sacrifice, in time, brings the consolation of spiritual joy for a hard duty nobly done

leadIns: 1260b ch A to A-3 & A-8 to F-B
269.description: B’s father, F-B, bankrupt, refuses to give B in marriage to wealthy A-3, a man she does not love, in discharge of his debts

270.description: B adores A 327b in secret; and when A disappears and reappears with a bride, B still finds her happiness in the great, unselfish love she still has for him

271.description: A and B are in love; but A realizes that if he, of an inferior race, should marry B, of a superior race, the result would be disastrous to both of them

272.description: A falls in love with B, after taking vows that forbid marriage, or love of woman

273.description: A falls in love with B, who is betrothed to his friend, A-2

274.description: A becomes involved in a love affair at the same time that he becomes involved in a divorce proceeding 45a as the “other man”

275.description: A and B, their families at enmity, fall in love with each other

276.description: A and B fall in love; but their fathers, F-A and F-B, are bitter political enemies

277.description: B falls in love with A, who jilts a friend of B’s, B-2 98 ch B to B-2 324 ch B to B-2 & B-3 to B in order to pay suit to B * B-2 grieves so terribly over losing her false lover, A, that B’s heart is wrung **

278.description: B suffers persecution and sorrow by falling in love with A, who is married but is unable to tell her that he is married

279.description: B, unmarried, falls in love with A, married * B, unmarried, falling in love with A, husband of B-3, is overcome with remorse. B flees from A and from the world to a solitary spot where she seeks to do penance and obtain a spiritual victory over her evil nature

283.description: B loves A, but rejects his love because of petty differences, and because her father, F-B, is an enemy of A’s father, F-A

284.description: B, in love with A, is compelled by her parents, F-B and M-B, to marry A-3

285.description: B cannot marry A, the man she loves, because of her promise to live with her widowed father, F-B, and make a home for him

286.description: B is ordered by her parents to have nothing to do with A * B allows herself to be governed by filial duty when her parents, F-B and M-B, order her to have nothing to do with A, the man she loves **

287.description: A finds that he cannot do justice to his chosen career if he marries B, the woman he loves

288.description: A fears he has inherited the evil traits of an ancestor * A, because he fears he has inherited the evil traits of an ancestor, dares not ask B, the woman he loves, to marry him **

289.description: A, in love with B and engaged to marry her, has almost wrecked his life with dissipation and feels that he should give B up

290.description: B is in love with A, but the sentiment of her family is against A and ranged on the side of A-3, A’s rival in love

291.description: B loves, and is beloved by, A, a man who is poor but of admirable character; but B, accustomed to luxury, shrinks from the idea of poverty, even with love

292.description: A considers B the acme of womanly perfection * A considers B the acme of womanly perfection; yet B, on the contrary, is a woman of doubtful character **

293.description: A is an aristocrat; and B, the woman he loves, is a “daughter of the people” and hates the aristocracy

296.description: A tells B, with whom he is in love, that he has killed A-3 * A tells B, the woman he loves, that he has killed A-3. and asks her to call the police **

297.description: A is the presiding magistrate at the trial for murder of B 10c 14a 27, the woman he loves

299.description: A is in love with B; but F-B, father of B, orders A to keep away from the house and away from B

300.description: A is in love with B; and B is plighted to A-3—a fact which A suddenly discovers

302.description: A, if he marries B, the woman he loves 305, will be disinherited

303.description: A’s love for B meets with obstacles because: [1] A is poor 291 127a 125a 313; [2] too old 1d; [3] too young 37 124; [4] of inferior family 171 245; [5] of superior family 3a, b 232; [6] one of the “idle rich” 98 924b; [7] inherits a mental or physical taint 255 288; [8] is of questionable character 59 108 152a; [9] is divorced 334b 377a ch B to B-8 388; [10] is an ex-convict 338 695b; [11] is “under a cloud” 80a 237 274; or [12] wealthy

304.description: A is resolved to marry B, but relentless duty stands in the way

leadIns: 818c ch A to A-8 & CH to B
305.description: B is a white woman who knows nothing of her birth and parentage * B’s rejected lover, A, spreads the report that there is negro blood in B’s veins **

306.description: B, in love with A, is detained by her father, F-B, when she seeks to keep an appointment with A

307.description: B, compelled by circumstances to be a companion of A 898 -* 925 -* in an isolated place 688, alters her rosy views of love and marriage when she discovers, through A, the selfishness of men

carryOns: 397 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
400 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
402 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
309.description: B and A are in love; but B, unknown to A, is already married

310.description: B breaks her engagement to marry A because she feels unequal to the responsibilities of married life

311.description: B’s parents, F-B and M-B, disapprove of A, B’s lover, because of his lack of enterprise

312.description: B’s love for A encounters obstacles because: [1] Either B’s father, F-B, or mother, M-B, knows a secret supposedly infamous regarding A 98 ch B to B-8 918a; [2] M-B and F-B are jealous of B and do not want her to marry any one 286 299; [3] B is the sole support of M-B and F-B 992 1032; or [4] B has a career before her which marriage would render impossible

313.description: A has been promised B in marriage by F-B, father of B ; but F-B, false to his promise, compels B to marry A-3, a wealthier man than A

314.description: A, in love with B and about to marry her, is detained and does not reach B’s house in time for the wedding 130 154a 664 711a 719a 1040 * A, prevented by circumstances from marrying B, as planned, discovers the unworthiness of B 27 and decides not to marry her at all **

carryOns: 24a, b, c, d, e tr B & B-3
315.description: A’s love is rejected by B; and A, in an effort to forget, buries himself in an isolated part of the country

316.description: A, when B fails to keep a tryst with him. considers the failure a rejection of love

317.description: A is in love with B, but B proves false to him

318.description: A sees in a newspaper the announcement of the engagement of B, the woman he loves, to A-3

319.description: A, in love with B, secretly discovers that B is about to marry his friend, A-2

320.description: A, in love with B, thinks B is a confirmed coquette, and is merely playing with him

323.description: B, of alien blood and inferior race, is abandoned by A, a white man with whom she is in love

324.description: B loses the love of A when B-3 comes into his life

325.description: B, suffering disappointment in love, resigns herself philosophically to her fate

326.description: B loves A with all her heart but refuses his proposal of marriage because [1] she is so much older than A 37 124; [2] she discovers that A does not love her 142 162a; [3] she considers A an impractical dreamer 958 136b; [4] she feels herself under a compelling obligation

328.description: A and B are in love and betrothed; A, supposed dead by B, returns and finds B arrayed for marriage with A-3 284 339 and accuses her of faithlessness

329.description: A falls in love with B in spite of the fact that his friend, A-2, has warned him against her

331.description: B, a Polynesian woman, challenges racial conventions by falling in love with A 687 689, a white man

332.description: B, of alien blood and inferior race, seeks to marry A, the Caucasian with whom she is in love

333.description: A makes a gift to B, the woman he wishes to marry—a gift of value, X, which is proved to have been stolen

335.description: A, in love with B, discovers that B’s desire for a career is an obstacle to their marriage

338.description: A is told by B-7, a maid in the home of B, A’s sweetheart, that B has informed the police of A’s criminal operations 1192 1194, and that he is an ex-convict

339.description: B, supposing A, the man she loves, to be dead, yields to the wishes of her parents, F-B and M-B, and consents to a marriage with A-3

340.description: B, who loves A and is beloved by him, loses him to B-3 through the wily strategy of B-3

341.description: B’s mother, M-B, is determined that B shall marry wealth; so, rejecting the man she loves, who is poor, to marry the man she does not love, who is rich, B is plunged into unhappiness

342.description: A is sent into desperate danger by capricious B, on the very eve of their marriage * B, capriciously sending her lover into desperate danger, drains the bitter cup of remorse **

343.description: A is estranged from B, the woman he loves, because of a difference of opinion over a trivial matter * A discovers B was right, acknowledges his error, achieves a reconciliation, and presently they are married **

344.description: A is estranged from his sweetheart, B, and B refuses to return money A had given her to save for him * A falls into misfortune 601 604; and his sweetheart B, from whom he is estranged returns money she has been saving for him, effects a reconciliation, and their marriage follows **

345.description: A, his love rejected by B-3, goes to a distant part of the country and meets B 9a, b 22a. A falls in love with B * B-3, filled with remorse because she rejected A’s love, goes searching for him, finds him, and is informed by him that he is presently to marry B **

346.description: B, of an inferior race, rescues A, of a superior race, and falls in love with him. A is engaged to marry B-3, a girl of his own people * A, telling B of an inferior race who is in love with him, that he is going away but will soon return, never returns, but marries B 3, a girl of his own people **

348.description: A’s enemy, A-3, is captain of a ship on which A has taken passage, and on which B 87 is a stowaway * A-3, knowing a secret of A’s 347a -*, compels A to marry B, A-3 performing the ceremony **

349.description: A’s gift to his sweetheart, B, is returned by B to A on account of a lovers’ quarrel * A’s gift, returned by B on account of a lovers’ quarrel, is sent back to B, unknown to A, by A-2, a friend of both B and A; and attached to the gift is a note requesting B to keep it until A calls for it in person ** A, estranged from B, is influenced by A-2 to call on B; and the result of the call is reconciliation and marriage ***

leadIns: 1223a ch A to F-B & A-4 to A
1223b ch A to F-B, A-4 to A & A-8 to A-3
350.description: A and A-3, rivals for the love of B, are put to a secret, gruelling test of worthiness by F-B, father of B * A and A-3 are lured into a secret ordeal to prove their merit; A-3 flunks completely, but A succeeds almost at cost of his life ** F-B approves of A, and he marries B ***

353.description: A is supposed by B’s parents, F-B and M-B, to be A-2, to whom B is betrothed * A elopes with B and marries her; A then returns B to F-B and M-B, tells them that A-2, to whom B was betrothed, is dead, and asks and receives the parental blessing **

355.description: B, capable of winning a contest against her lover, A, deliberately suffers defeat—because it has been agreed that she shall marry A if he wins

356.description: B could easily win a contest, but she deliberately allows herself to be defeated, thereby losing wealth, but winning in marriage poor A, the man she loves

357.description: B, knowing that her sweetheart, A, believes her to have perished in a tragic accident discovers by secret enterprise 82a 87 that A has remained true to her 497 ch “wife” to “sweetheart” reveals her identity and they marry

358.description: B, a working girl, discovers that her lover, A, is wealthy and only pretending to be a toiler * B pretends to be wealthy, and merely masquerading as a shop girl ** In order to win B, A is compelled to confess his true rank and station *** B, having given A a Roland for his Oliver, reveals to A her own rank and station ****

359.description: B, unworthy, wins the love of worthy A; and B, by pretending to be worthy, presently achieves worthiness * —and a reward of married happiness **

362.description: A and B are lovers, their families at enmity. A and B elope and are pursued by their rival kindred * A and B, eloping and hotly pursued by their rival kindred, are suddenly plunged into terrible danger. A makes a heroic rescue of B under the very eyes of their anguished relatives ** Out of A’s heroic rescue of B is born a reconciliation of opposing houses, and married happiness for A and B ***

366.description: A refuses an inheritance because of a restriction that he must not marry; then he marries B

369.description: A and B, married and devotedly in love with each other, are hasty and intolerant * A and B quarrel 372 373, and an estrangement results **

370.description: A, husband of B, loves B devotedly, but he is so constituted that he never shows his true feelings and often masks them with something that suggests their exact opposite * B mourns over the mistaken belief that she has lost A’s love **

371.description: A is suspected of having murdered 416 417 his wife, B

372.description: A and B, devotedly in love with each other, through failure to understand each other’s ideals 898 899 -* 908 976, develop an incompatability which results in frequent quarrels

373.description: A is so much older than B that, after their marriage, the discrepancy in their ages 808b becomes the cause of quarrels and, finally, of estrangement

374.description: A believed B was of an artistic nature * After marriage, A is sorely disappointed on discovering that B is indolent in the pursuit of a career **

375.description: A is more capable than his wife, B, although B thoughtlessly treats him as mentally inferior

376.description: A, husband of B, holds B in subjection * A is a religious fanatic who makes B miserable with his petty domination **

378.description: A, marrying a widow, B, discovers that he has “caught a tartar” and has wedded a domestic tyrant

379.description: A suffers the loss of happiness in carrying out honorably a distasteful obligation to divorce his wife, B

380.description: A is jealous of his wife, B * A embarks upon an ill-considered enterprise of gambling and loses money that is not his to lose ** A gambles with A-3, the man with whom A believes his wife has an “affair” ***

381.description: A finds a note 561 562 582 tr B & A, somewhat ambiguously worded, which leads him to a wrong conclusion regarding the conduct of his wife, B * A is fired to seek revenge **

382.description: A, in order to restore to B, without a confession of culpability, wealth of which he has secretly defrauded her, marries her * Then he falls in love with B-3 **

383.description: A’s wife, B, has a birthmark which mars her beauty * Influenced by the thought, A grows discontented, and his love begins to wane **

leadIns: 1009a, b ch B to M-A & SN to A
384.description: A and B, married, live with A’s mother. M-A * B quarrels with M-A, and with A on account of M-A **

386.description: A leaves his devoted, loving wife, B, to take up with B-3, a woman who flatters his vanity * B-3 is wealthy, but shallow; and A, in following her advice, fails miserably in all his undertakings **

387.description: A presents his wife, B, with a gift as a testimonial of his love * 1333a A finds B dead, slain by the gift he had presented to her **

388.description: A divorces B, then seeks a second marriage with her * B’s health was declining and beauty fading when A secured his divorce from her ** B, her health restored, considers heself well rid of A ***

carryOns: 245 ch A to SN-A, son of A
305 ch B to D-B, daughter of A’s second wife
389.description: A, thinking his first wife is dead 49 400 486a, marries again and has children by his second wife * A learns that his first wife was living at the time of his second marriage, but that she has died since his second marriage ** This invalidates the second marriage *** A seeks to make a new will and go through another marriage ceremony with his second wife, but is killed in an accident on his way to his lawyer’s **** Thus the children of A’s second marriage are illegitimate, and A’s property descends to the relatives of A’s deceased first wife *****

390.description: A, through accident 711b loses an object, X, belonging to his friend, A-2, at the door of a woman whose character is not of the best * X, an object belonging to A-2, is lost by A in a place of evil character, and, found, is sent by a mischief maker to A-2’s wife with a note stating where it was found 478 ** A-2, falsely suspected of transgression, finds himself in a most unhappy position until A, by a statement of the facts, clears A-2 of suspicion ***

391.description: A, through mistaken judgment, becomes estranged from his loving wife, B * A has a foolish escapade with B-3 386 540, whereby his eyes are opened to his error and folly ** A, enlightened and transformed by the revelation of his error, returns humbly to his wife, B ***

392.description: A believes he sees the apparition of his dead wife, B * A struggles to overtake the fleeing apparition of B, falls from a cliff and meets his death **

393.description: A, married to B, is haunted by memories of a former sweetheart, B-3 * Because of his memories, A’s married happiness is not what it should be ** A finds B-3, his love of other days, and discovers that her beauty and charm have faded 244 ch B to B-3 211 ch B to B-3 A knows at once that his emancipation from the. evil influence of B-3 is complete, and he returns to B a better and a wiser man ***

394.description: A, married to B, escapes from B on plausible pretexts 443 -* and lives in a furnished room for a few days each month * B discovers A’s deceit 443 *-****, trails him, and learns how A is merely seeking home comforts denied him by B ** 417 478 B, realizing suddenly the injustice her exacting nature has been causing A, promises to be different—and there is a reconciliation ***

395.description: A’s ideal of married happiness is tranquility and comfort * A’s wife, B, proves herself a termagant, and quarrels are frequent **

396.description: A learns that his wife, B, has been true to him * A-3, the man with whom A thought B had eloped, A discovers, was married several days before the date of the supposed elopement **

397.description: B, married to A, has a flirtation with A-3, unmarried * Married B is away with unmarried A-3 when A-3 suddenly dies **

399.description: B is the sensible, devoted wife of A * A is the victim of egotistical self-deception ** A, advised wisely by B, thinks B is jealous of his great abilities *** An estrangement results ****

400.description: B deserts her husband, A, for another man, A-3 * B, deserting her husband, A, for A-3, discovers that A-3 is in love with another married woman **

401.description: B’s husband, A, has failed to return home and B is worried about him * B, thinking her husband A is in danger, plunges into danger herself on the chance of finding him and helping him **

402.description: B, married to A, supposes A is dead and marries A-3 339 * A, supposed to be dead, returns mysteriously as from the grave ** A seeks to force B to give up A-3. the man she has married ***

403.description: B’s husband, A, is brutal and tyrannical * Goaded beyond her powers of endurance, B puts poison in a glass and gives it to A ** B, giving her husband, A, poison, flees before the poison has time to take effect ***

carryOns: 261 ch B to A & A-3 to B-3
404.description: B, after a loveless marriage with A-3, obtains a divorce and begins searching for A, the man she loves and from whom she became estranged

405.description: B is the second wife of A, a widower * A, thinking he has been disloyal to his first wife, B-3, makes B unhappy by his brooding **

406.description: B, just married to A, tells A she does not love him * B informs her husband, A, that she married him from pique and because A-3, the man she loves, married B-3 **

407.description: B is flogged by her husband, A, for a transgression 445a -* 483b 553 381 -* she did not commit

408.description: B, wife of A, keeps their house so well-ordered, and is so tyrannical and unreasonable about it, that A’s home life becomes a hell

409.description: B, wife of A, informs A that she is in love with A-3

410.description: B has committed a secret transgression in order to help her husband, A * B finds herself in the toils of A-5 **

412.description: B, wife of A, is annoyed by the little mannerisms of A: The crook of his elbow as he lifts a cup or glass, his endless repetition of what he considers humorous stories, his old carpet slippers, his habit of snoring when he takes his afternoon nap, etc. These trifling banalities so work on B’s nerves that bitter quarrels result

413.description: B marries A, a man much older than herself * B does not love A but thought when she married him that he would help her realize her consuming ambition ** B’s great desire is to become an actress *** A, husband of B, proves a brutal tyrant and gives B nothing but harsh and inconsiderate treatment ****

414.description: B, wife of A, admires the personal independence of B-2 and would pattern after her * A has no admiration at all for B-2 and her ways **

415.description: B learns that her supposed legal marriage to A was a farce * B is abandoned by A and left penniless and alone **

416.description: B, wife of A, dies as the result of an enterprise undertaken for her supposed benefit

417.description: B, while too severely reprimanding her husband, A, bursts a blood vessel and expires

418.description: B, married, quarrels with her husband, A, and runs away from home in an attempt to find peace and contentment * B has an experience with A-3 which proves to her that running away from, her husband, A, was a mistake **

419.description: A must have his abilities recognized by his wife, B, in order to be happy 432a 463 * A leaves B to run their joint business enterprise alone, and goes to a distant place, knowing that his absence will cause B to discover his business worth **

420.description: A lives unhappily with his wife, B * A’s marital discontent prompts him to reckless and questionable adventures **

421.description: A marries B in order to emancipate himself from the evil influence of B-3 * B-3 is a heartless coquette whom A loves **

424.description: A, an artist, works secretly as a day laborer in order to help his wife, B, who is also an artist * A tells B he is “realizing money on his art” **

425.description: A has a son by his white wife, B. B dies * A, while traveling abroad 917, marries B-3, a woman of inferior race 347a ch B to B-3 901 ch B to B-3, abandons her and returns to his own country ** This secret A craftily keeps from his son, SN-A ***

426.description: A, married to B and desiring his freedom, resorts to craftiness * A persuades his friend, A-2. to elope with B **

427.description: A, married to B, is impelled by an unusual motive to furnish a suite of bachelor lodgings in another town. He does this unknown to B * A secretly retires to his bachelor apartments and lives a hermitlike existence **

428.description: A and his wife, B, are artists. Their art does not prosper * A and B encounter dire misfortune. Each seeks some secret method of recouping their joint finances **

430.description: A, husband of B, is heavily in debt * A disappears mysteriously **

431.description: A, wealthy and desiring to be poor, has married B in order that she may spend his money
