2b.description: A, a fugitive from the law and using a fictitious name, falls in love with B * A, craftily engaged in a secret enterprise, falls in love with B 1146 ch A to B 1169 ch A to B who has also embarked upon a crafty enterprise **

2c.description: A, one of the “idle rich,” gratifies his love of adventure by frequenting the slums in the character of a city “tough” * A, disguised as a city “tough,” meets B, and they fall in love **

2d.description: A is mistaken by B for A-8. B has corresponded with A-8 but has never seen him * A, falling in love with B, pretends that he is A-8 **

2e.description: B, wealthy, devotes much time to settlement work; and, in carrying out her philanthropic enterprises, she pretends to be a shop girl * B, while posing as a shop girl, meets A, and they fall in love **

2f.description: B, poor and humble but romantic, acquires unexpectedly a small sum of money; thus financed, she pretends for a time to be wealthy and aristocratic * B, poor and humble but pretending to be wealthy and aristocratic, meets rich and influential A 1163c and they fall in love **

2g.description: B, a maid, uses the wardrobe of her wealthy mistress and pretends to be a distinguished personage * B, poor but pretending to be wealthy and aristocratic, meets rich and influential A 1148a and they fall in love **

2h.description: B, a criminal, assumes an alias and makes use of stolen funds in evading the law * B, a criminal in disguise, meets A 1169 1175a 1181 and they fall in love **

3a.description: A is a judge, and B is a fugitive from justice posing as a woman of wealth and fashion * A, a judge, falls in love with B, a criminal **

3b.description: A, a detective, falls in love with B, the criminal he has arrested and is returning to the scene of her crime for trial and punishment

4a.description: A, seeking to uncover duplicity by crafty enterprise, encounters the unexpected * A, seeking to uncover duplicity, falls in love with B, supposed to be guilty of the duplicity **

4b.description: A recovers property belonging to an unknown woman, B * A, in a spirit of altruism, restores property to an unknown woman, B—and falls in love with her **

6a.description: A, traveling the highroad, drops a purse of money unnoticed * B, who has long desired to know A, picks up a purse he has dropped and restores it. A and B fall in love **

6b.description: A, a judge, loses his brief case * B finds a lost brief case belonging to A, a judge, and restores it to him; and the acquaintance, thus begun, ripens into love **

7a.description: A is crude, unhandsome and repellant to the ladies, although he desires to be a gallant * A receives from A-7 a small object of mystery, X, which A-7 declares will make him redoubtable in love. A takes X and fares forth to try it **

7b.description: A is in love with B and fears his affair is hopeless * A, in order to prosper his love affair with B, secures a love philtre from the Seventh Son of a Seventh Son—a philtre that is guaranteed to bring him the love of B **

8a.description: A has a repellant personality and, knowing it, he is timid in love * A is timid in love but, armed with a love charm, X, he becomes bold, and wins success **

8b.description: A’s love affair with B is not prospering. A secures a love philtre and mixes it secretly in a cup of tea; but B’s maiden aunt, AU-B, drinks the tea

9a.description: A and B, both single, craftily covenant and agree to ban love in their associations * A and B, engaging in an enterprise, mutually covenant and agree to ban love; but love enters into their little scheme in spite of their platonic notions **

9b.description: A and B, young and single, enter into a business co-partnership * A and B, entering into a business co-partnership, ban love with every legal device—but in vain **

9c.description: B’s cattle ranch was left to her by her father; and every man B hires as foreman makes love to her sooner or later, and is discharged * B hires A as foreman on her ranch, and he promises to keep his place and not make love to her; but B falls in love with him, and is presently glad to learn that A’s sole purpose in taking the job of foreman was to win her love **

10a.description: B is a criminal, and A is the detective who has arrested her * B, a criminal arrested by A, a detective, brings her charms to bear upon A in the hope of effecting her escape **

10b.description: B, poor and in great misfortune, is befriended by wealthy A * B, poor, seeks to win the love of wealthy A **

10c.description: B makes love to A in an attempt to escape misfortune

carryOns: 324 ch B to M-B & B-3 to B
11a.description: B’s mother, M-B, a middle-aged widow, introduces A, her youthful lover, to B * B’s mother, M-B, plans that her youthful lover, A, shall transfer his affections to B. M-B’s plans are successful **

carryOns: 11a ch B to B-3 and “daughter” to “friend”
11b.description: B, middle-aged, and A, a youth, are in love with each other * B, elderly, in love with youthful A, seeks to have A transfer his affections to B-3, who is nearer his own age **

11c.description: B, who is unworthy, finds that she has won the love of worthy A * B, unworthy, seeks to have her lover, A, transfer his affections to B-3, who is worthy **

12a.description: A and B, each secretly, suppose themselves transgressors of the law * A and B,. supposing themselves fugitives from the law, meet in a foreign country and fall in love **

12b.description: A, unmarried, and B, married, are shipwrecked and cast away on a desert island * A, unmarried, and B, married, fall in love when B supposes A to be her ideal. And then B makes a discovery **

13a.description: B is discouraged regarding her romantic affairs * B, discouraged regarding her love affairs, meets with a “sign” which prophesies her marriage within a year **

13b.description: B, as the world would have it, is an “inferior” person * B, an “inferior” person, falls in love with a “superior” person, A; and A’s apparent love for her gives her the power to bear patiently the misfortunes of her humble estate **

14a.description: B, almost overwhelmed by misfortune, meets A, and they fall in love * B, winning the love of A, finds the courage to bear patiently with her hardships **

14b.description: B finds herself in a great city, penniless and the victim of evil intrigue * B, helpless and in misfortune, meets a stranger, A, and they fall in love **

14c.description: B, an attractive young widow, meets A, an equally attractive young widower * B, a widow, and A, a widower, meet in a cemetery where each comes with flowers for her and his lost spouse—and they fall in love **

15a.description: B, plain and humble working girl, falls in love with A

15b.description: B, plain and humble “slavey,” secretly adores A * A does not dream that humble B is in love with him **

16a.description: A, a detective, has arrested B, a criminal, and is returning her to the scene of her crime for trial and punishment * A, a detective, falls in love with B, a criminal whom he has arrested **

16b.description: A has taken vows that proscribe the love of woman * A, although he has taken vows that proscribe the love of woman, nevertheless falls in love with B **

17a.description: A, unmarried, and B, married, thrown together in a solitary and lonely environment, fall in love

leadIns: 561 ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
503b ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
carryOns: 568b ch A to A-8 & A-3 to A
17b.description: A, unmarried, out of sympathy for B, who is unhappily married to brutal and tyrannical A-8, falls in love with B

19a.description: A falls in love with B, and renounces wealth which he was to inherit by marrying BX

19b.description: A, under threat of being disinherited, is ordered to commit an act that will prove a grievous injury to a near relative of B’s, the woman he loves, A refuses

20a.description: A seeks to buy an object, X, from B, an object he greatly desires. B will not sell * A and B, while engaged in a commercial transaction, fall in love **

20b.description: A meets B while engaged in an enterprise, of indirection, and clever B finds a flaw in his explanations; B, also, is entangled in a snare of indirection, and A’s suspicions are aroused * A and B are mutually involved in a snare of indirection; nevertheless, they are drawn to each other and fall in love **

20c.description: A is a young lawyer, retained by B to help her settle the involved estate of her deceased father, F-B * A and B, during their meetings as lawyer and client, fall in love **

22a.description: A is a woman-hater, but he is rendered, a service by B which causes him to revise his opinions of the opposite sex * A, a woman-hater, falls in love with B **

22b.description: A has an experience with B which causes him to become a woman-hater

23a.description: B, an “inferior” person, falls in love with A, a “superior” person, and seeks to win him in marriage

23b.description: B, of an inferior race, falls in love with A, of a superior race

23c.description: A, of an inferior race, falls in love with B, of a superior race

23d.description: A, wealthy and of high social position, falls in love with humble B

24a.description: A loses his heart to B, a woman he does not know, and wishes to marry her

24b.description: A, attracted by the loveliness of B, loses his heart to her

24c.description: A sees a photograph of B, a woman he does not know * A, studying a photograph of unknown B, falls in love with her **

24d.description: A, hearing of the character and charms of B, a woman he has never met, falls in love with her and resolves to win her in marriage

24e.description: A, of an inordinately romantic temperament, sees the hand of B; and, because of the hand’s shapeliness and beauty, falls in love with the owner, B

26a.description: A and B have never seen each other; but, through their fathers, F-A and F-B, who are old friends, it is arranged that A and B shall meet and marry

26b.description: A and B have never seen each other; but they correspond, and through their correspondence become betrothed

28a.description: B, very ill and under the doctor’s care, fancies herself in love with the doctor, A

28b.description: B, suffering misfortune with A, fancies herself in love with him

40a.description: A presents his sweetheart, B, with a novel; and the story, unknown to A, contains a character described as an adventuress in terms that exactly fit B. Or, the novel which A, by mistake, wraps up and sends to B was a gift to A from a former sweetheart, her name and his on the fly leaf, and various love passages marked. Or, there is something left by chance between the pages of the book at which B takes offense. Or, some of the incidents of the story (which A has not read), approximate events in the affair of A and B with slighting references to B

40b.description: A encounters disappointment in love when B fails to answer a note he sent her

41a.description: A, in love with B, refuses the wise counsel of B in business affairs, and an estrangement follows

41b.description: A has promised B, the woman he loves, that he will give up a practice which B considers discreditable * A, yielding to temptation, proves false to a promise he made his sweetheart, B, and an estrangement follows

41c.description: A persists in taking measures against one of the family of B, A’s sweetheart, in spite of the protests of B. An estrangement follows

42a.description: A, in love with B, discovers that B is in love with B-2

42b.description: B, in love with A, discovers that A, Narcissus like, is in love with A

44a.description: A, a publisher in love with B, receives a manuscript novel from A-4, in which a woman character, approximating B physically and temperamentally, is made the rogue of the story * A, a publisher, rejects a novel because of personal pique

44b.description: A is so absorbed in his love affair with B that it has a disastrous effect upon his business enterprises

45a.description: A discovers that B, unhappily married, is—innocently on his own part—in love with him

45b.description: A, kind to humble B and considering her merely as a friend, is amazed to learn that she is in love with him

47a.description: A asks that B allow herself to be hypnotized in order that he may learn where buried treasure has been concealed 1394 * A hypnotizes B, and B dies of psychic shock **

47b.description: A persuades his sweetheart, B, to assume a fictitious character for the purpose of acquiring gain by transgression—with unhappy consequences for both of them

51a.description: A loves B, and, when A confesses to B that he once committed a murder, B’s health declines and she worries herself into her grave

carryOns: 1269 ch A to B & A-2 to A
51b.description: A confesses to B, his sweetheart, that he once committed a transgression, and the result of the confession proves disastrous

52a.description: A, a fugitive from justice, hiding in the bush, through error shoots and kills B, his sweetheart, when he hears some one approaching his hiding place

52b.description: A, seeking to benefit B, undertakes an enterprise which results disastrously

54a.description: A is in love with B. One evening, as usual, A calls to see B ; but, where her beautiful home had stood, no later than the evening before, there is now only an ancient, timestained tomb—the tomb of B, who had died a hundred years before A was born

54b.description: A, investigating a psychic mystery, falls in love with B * B, apparently in her early twenties, is dazzlingly beautiful; but she is really very old, and in her case the ravages of time were stayed in early youth by a psychic shock. A’s love dissolves the spell; and, under A’s eyes, B ages and her beauty fades **

58a.description: B invents a wholly imaginary lover, AX; and, most unexpectedly, a man of AX’s name and general characteristics, presents himself to her

58b.description: B pretends that she is engaged to be married to an imaginary lover, AX, buys herself an engagement ring, and has the betrothal announcement published in a newspaper

58c.description: B, single, pretends that she is a married woman and assumes the name of “Mrs. Blank”

66a.description: A, his love rejected by B, revenges himself by cutting off B’s long hair

66b.description: A, his love rejected by B, seeks revenge on the sex by becoming a heart-breaker, and a betrayer

66c.description: A, his love rejected by B, seeks revenge by making love to eligible, wealthy women and getting money from them

71a.description: A seeks to escape annoying manifestations of love * A, in order to escape annoying manifestations of love, pretends [1] that a wax figure, X, is his invalid wife; [2] pretends that he is married; [3] pretends that he is engaged to be married

71b.description: B, in order to escape annoying manifestations of love, resorts to simulation

74a.description: A, young and romantic, sees a ruinous old house in a city street, a house said to be deserted. * A, his curiosity aroused, secretly watches the house; then, one day, he sees a beautifully rounded arm and a small, shapely hand 953 ch A to B 403 emerge from behind a broken blind and place something on the window sill **

74b.description: A, hearing a woman’s voice calling for help in a house he happens to be passing, rushes up the steps, through the front door—and into a romantic complication

75a.description: A and A-3 are in love with B. A-3 seeks by craftiness to eliminate A

75b.description: A, through the wily manoeuvers of A-3. his rival in love, is innocently lured into a compromising situation by B-5, woman confederate of A-3

80a.description: A, in order to ensure the happiness of B 85a whom he loves devotedly and who, he thinks, loves his rival, A-3 177 ch A to A-3 1175a ch A to A-3, fiees secretly so it may appear that he, and not A-3, committed a certain transgression

80b.description: A and A-3 are rivals for the love of B, and A learns that B prefers A-3. A, in order to insure the happiness of B and A-3 slays himself and leaves his estate to B and A-3

82a.description: B disguises herself and meets A, the man she loves, as an Unknown * B seeks to discover whether A really loves her **

82b.description: B resorts to simulation in order to discover whether A, the man she loves, really loves her

84a.description: B, in order to be free of unwelcome lovers, invents a mechanical figure, X, which she pretends is her husband

84b.description: A, annoyed by unwelcome love affairs, pretends that he has an invalid wife, BX

85a.description: B, in love with A, treats A harshly in an attempt to arouse his anger and spur him into proving his abilities

85b.description: B seeks to prove A’s love for her by a stratagem * B deliberately manoeuvers herself and A into a compromising situation, and then places the responsibility squarely upon A **

90a.description: B elopes with A, who promises her a theatrical engagement

90b.description: B’s ambition is to do B-3 an injury; so she elopes with A, who is engaged to marry B-3

93a.description: B, wealthy, pretends to lose all her money in an unfortunate investment, by way of discovering which of her lovers loves her for herself alone

93b.description: B, seeking to prove whether or not A really loves her 141, has recourse to a stratagem

94a.description: B and A are in love. B-3, by craftiness 138 215a steals A away from B 216 * then B, matching her own craftiness against B-3’s, steals B-3’s thunder and wins A back again 359 361a, b **

94b.description: B’s friend, B-2, an attractive married woman, seeks to save A, B’s fiance, from the wiles of a designing woman, B-3, and restore him to B. B-2 does this by winning A away from B-3

101a.description: A is so besieged by match-making mammas that their meddling seriously interferes with the practice of his profession. He resolves to escape the annoyance by a stratagem

101b.description: A is a sentimental person, fancy free but yearning for love * A is a poet, fancy free, who keeps his lightning rods up in the hope of attracting a bolt of the divine passion **

125a.description: B, in love with A, who is unfortunate and unenterprising, sees an opportunity for A to make great gain and influences him to take advantage of it

125b.description: B, in love with A who is forgetful and absent-minded, is asked by A to marry him. B tells A to call on her for his answer on a certain day at a certain hour. If he can remember to come, B is resolved to accept him

125c.description: B is in love with A, who is engaged in settling the estate of B’s deceased father, F-B * B’s father, F-B, deceased, was heavily in debt, and A, wealthy, pays the debts unknown to B **

127a.description: A believes that B will not marry him until he becomes wealthy

127b.description: A believes that B will not marry him until he overcomes his personal limitations

134a.description: A, and the woman he loves, B, are lost in the woods; and it is evident that they will have to remain in the woods all night

134b.description: A, and B with whom A is in love, find themselves trapped in a ruinous old house from which escape seems impossible. Night is coming on, and B accuses A of seeking to compromise her so that he may win her in marriage

137a.description: A and A-3, twin brothers, are both in love with B

137b.description: B and SR-B, twin sisters, are both in love with A

leadIns: 982a ch A to A-8 & NW to A
152a.description: A is a youth who is “wild” and hard to manage; he falls in love with B 812b ; 230 tr A & B 224 and his character is transformed

152b.description: A’s secretary, B, is a criminal, “planted” in A’s home by A-5, a crook * B, a criminal, confederate of A-5, a crook, falls in love with her employer, A **

154a.description: A, planning to meet B at a country church where they are to be secretly married, becomes lost in a storm and does not reach the church until B, and all the others, have left

154b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, learning of the plans of A and B for a secret marriage, sends an automobile to the church with a confederate, A-5, who lures B away by telling her A has sent for her

162a.description: B, in love with A, is uncertain of A’s affections

162b.description: B has been betrayed, and her child is to be born out of wedlock * B, a poor unfortunate, meditates suicide as the only way out of her misfortunes **

167a.description: B, her first lover having died, after some years falls in love a second time. AX, the man she loves, greatly cast down, tells B he is already married, and to a woman he does not even know, BX. He recites the circumstances 365b ch B to BX 365c ch B to BX 365d ; * and then strangely, even implausibly, it develops that BX is B. 166 ch B to BX **

167b.description: B, failing miserably in her chosen line of work, takes “the easier way” and becomes the mistress of A

176a.description: B, seeking to make a test of her lover’s devotion, capriciously sends him into desperate danger

176b.description: B, seeking to make a test of her lover’s devotion, capriciously plunges into danger to see if he will follow her

176c.description: B promises A that she will marry him if he will successfully carry out a difficult enterprise

179a.description: A, by mental telepathy, becomes aware of a terrible danger threatening B, the woman he loves

179b.description: A, at a long distance from B, and in a lonely country, hears an agonized call from his sweetheart over the phone 483 ch “wife” to “sweetheart”

179c.description: A has a clairvoyant vision apprising him of danger that threatens his sweetheart, B

181a.description: A, riding his cow pony through the bleak hills, sees B, on a mettlesome horse, her bridle-rein broken, plunging helplessly toward the brink of a cliff. A, with a rattle of spurs, overtakes B and snatches her clear of the saddle.* Thereupon, love is declared and accepted 188a 241 360a **

leadIns: 135 ch A to SN & F-A to A
carryOns: 241 ch A to SN & F-A to A
159 ch A to SN & A-3 to A
181b.description: A’s son, SN, is determined to marry B, whom A thinks is unworthy * A, seeking to prevent his son, SN, from marrying B, makes love to B and plans to marry her himself

181c.description: A and A-4 held prisoners in a strange lost city, escape with the help of B, a supposed goddess * A is in love with B; and B, rescuing A and A-4 from their captors, flees with them when they effect their escape

182a.description: B, thinking she has received a proposal of marriaqe from A 192a 195, accepts. Later, she discovers it was A-3 76 160 who proposed

leadIns: 137b ch SR-B to B & B-3 to SR-B
182b.description: A is in love with B. Intending to propose marriage to B, he discovers that he has proposed to B-3 * A, thinking he is proposing marriage to B, finds that he has proposed to B-3, who accepts him **

188a.description: B, impelled by an unusual motive, agrees to marry A if she loses to him in a certain contest of skill [archery, shooting at a mark with rifle or revolver, solving a mystery] 1343 1364 1384 * B has the ability to defeat A in a certain contest if she so desires **

188b.description: B, about to commit suicide, is restrained by a stranger, A. A is informed by B that life is too bitter, since there is no name for her unborn child * A, a stranger, offers to marry B and so save her from a crowning disgrace **

192a.description: A, lacking courage to propose to B face to face, proposes over the telephone

192b.description: A sends his friend, A-2, to B with a proposal of marriage * A-2 proposes to B for A; and B, thinking A-2 is speaking for himself, accepts him **

194a.description: B, thinking A loves her and lacks the courage to make an avowal, proposes marriage to him after he has rescued her from a tragic accident

194b.description: B sends a telegram to A-3 accepting his offer of marriage * B, accepting A-3’s proposal of marriage by telegram, through error sends the telegram to A, the lover from whom she is estranged **

212a.description: A is pledged by B, the woman he loves, to undertake an enterprise that will bring him serious misfortune * B pledges A to an enterprise which, unknown to B, will bring him serious misfortune **

212b.description: A, having carried out successfully an enterprise instigated by capricious B, renounces her love

leadIns: 494 ch B to B-3, A to A-8 & A-3 to A
215a.description: A, because of the wiles of B-3. a coquette, breaks his engagement to marry B, whom he loves

215b.description: A is in love with both B and B-3 * While A debates within himself whether he shall propose marriage to B or B-3, B and B-3 engage themselves to marry other lovers

218a.description: A, although he loves B, is a conceited person * B-3 flatters A’s vanity and so maneuvers him into an engagement to marry her **

218b.description: A sends a gift to B, the woman he loves; B-3 intercepts the gift, and craftily replaces it with a photo of herself, lovingly inscribed to A

221a.description: A, in love with B, renounces his love when told by his friend, A-2, that it is unwise

221b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, abducts A and holds him a prisoner as a means of preventing him from marrying B

222a.description: A, in love with B, becomes estranged from B through mistaken judgment

222b.description: A, in love with B, secretly discovers B in the arms of A-4 * A, secretly discovering his sweetheart, B, in the arms of A-4, leaves in anger, unaware that A-4 is B’s brother 708 -* ch A to BR-B just returned after a long, mysterious absence **

234a.description: A loves B and would like to marry her, but B considers A a weakling and keeps him dangling * A, in order to prove his “courage” to B, stages a mock rescue **

234b.description: A, an aviator, is a person of masterful character * A, an aviator, in love with B and in disfavor with B’s parents, F-B and M-B, induces B to take a ride in his airplane; and then A elopes with B along the sky lanes **

246a.description: A, in love with B, of an inferior race, seeks to abandon B secretly in order to uphold a lofty conception of duty

246b.description: A, victim of an apparently hopeless love affair, seeks contentment in befriending all who are in need, especially those who are unjustly treated * A, by his enterprises in altruism, finds that his hard nature undergoes a beneficial change **

252a.description: B refuses A’s offer of marriage because she feels that A is too model a man for her to be happy with

252b.description: B refuses A’s offer of marriage because she feels that A is so absent-minded he might forget he has married her

257a.description: A falls in love with B; but love, in A’s case, is a transgression

257b.description: A loves B; but, after A meets with misfortune, B gives her favor to A-3, A’s rival in love

260a.description: A loves B, but is rejected for a rival, A-3, who, known to A but unknown to B, is a transgressor

260b.description: A loves B, but is estranged from her because he is so absent-minded and forgetful; he writes B a letter, assuring her that he has cured himself of his great failing—and forgets to post the letter

262a.description: B receives a letter from an unknown source * B, influenced by an anonymous communication, breaks her engagement to marry A **

262b.description: B, in love with A, receives an unsigned letter in which the writer states that she is the mistress of A and begs B not to take A away from her

262c.description: B, in love with A, receives an unsigned letter in which the writer states that she is the wife of A by a secret marriage, and asks B to use her influence in persuading A to return to her

265a.description: A, while in a psychic state, has a prophetic vision of his rival in love, A-3, discredited, and of himself achieving happiness in love

265b.description: A is very absent-minded * A, absent-minded, forgets that B has rejected his love and continues to pay court to her

280a.description: A discovers that A-3, his rival for the love of B, is a defaulter

carryOns: 1344 ch A to A-3 & A-2 to A
280b.description: A discovers that A-3, his rival for the love of B, is a transgressor. In order to prevent the truth from, becoming known, A-3 kills A

281a.description: A wishes to marry B, but is already united to B-3 365b ch B to B-3 354b by a secret marriage

281b.description: A, overwhelmed by misfortune in love, commits suicide

281c.description: A, poor, in love with B, suddenly puts forth a great effort and secures a large sum of money 1354b 1394 * A renounces his love for B and seeks to win wealthy B-3 **

282a.description: A’s sense of filial obligation is so strong that, when ordered by his father, F-A, not to marry B, the girl he loves, he gives her up

282b.description: A, an Indian, in love with B, a white girl, is commanded by his father, F-A, and by the head men of the tribe, to renounce B

294a.description: A discovers that his friend, A-2. is cruelly fickle in his love affair with B * A, discovering that his friend, A-2, is cruelly fickle in his love affair with B, takes him to task for it **

294b.description: A, in order to arouse the jealousy of his friend, A-2. and cure him of fickleness in love, pretends to be in love with B, A-2’s sweetheart

295a.description: A is in love with B; and he sues F-B, father of B, for damages sustained in a certain proceeding

295b.description: A, in love with B, and disapproved of by F-B, father of B, is forcibly ejected from the home of B by F-B. A brings suit for damages against F-B

298a.description: A, an eligible young man, is mystified by discovering in a newspaper the announcement of his betrothal to BX, a woman he does not know

leadIns: 1432 ch A to U-A & NW to A
298b.description: A is left a fortune by a deceased relative provided he will marry BX, a woman he does not know

298c.description: A is appealed to for aid by BX, a woman he does not know * A, appealed to for aid by a stranger, BX, refuses aid, and regrets the refusal when BX mysteriously disappears. A considers himself under an obligation to find BX

301a.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, is favored by F-B, father of B

301b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, finds a certain object B has lost, an object, X, that proves B’s love for A. A-3 appropriates X and says nothing about it

308a.description: B is locked in her room by her father, F-B, in order to prevent her from meeting her lover, A, and telling him of her love

308b.description: B sends a letter to her sweetheart, A, but it is intercepted by B’s father, F-B, who does not approve of A

308c.description: B sends a gift to A, the man she loves * Unknown to B, AU-B, an aunt of B’s who does not approve of A, secretly alters or marks the gift in such a way as to make it offensive to A, or exchanges the gift for some other object which will offend A 81 93b **

321a.description: A tries philosophically to make the best of fate when B, the woman he loves, refuses him

321b.description: A falls in love with B and intends to marry her. A’s parents, F-A and M-A, do not approve of B, and A is shipped off to South Africa to get him out of danger and give him a chance to do some serious thinking

322a.description: A, in love with B, finds her unresponsive, reserved and distant

322b.description: A’s love is rejected by B because, as she frankly tells him. he is hard-hearted and has made money his god * B advises A to go away somewhere and try to develop the generous side of his character **

327a.description: B loves A, but A, apparently, does not return her love

327b.description: B loves A; and A, who is kind to B but not in love with her, does not even suspect that he is the object of her affections

330a.description: A, wealthy, is in love with B. A’s friends, A-2, A-2, think that B is a designing fortune hunter

330b.description: A’s father, F-A, disapproves of B, A’s sweetheart * B, by secret enterprise 241, proves her charm and worth to A’s father, F-A, and he withdraws his objections to her marriage with A **

334a.description: A’s profession is a hazardous one—aviator, automobile racing driver, steeple jack. “human fly”—and B considers this fact an obstacle to their marriage

334b.description: A, in love with B, was divorced from his first wife. B’s parents, F-B and M-B, have religious scruples against B’s marrying a divorced man

336a.description: B loves A and is about to marry A-3. Accused of faithlessness by A, B shows a dagger, and declares that she intends to kill herself at the altar steps before A-3 can claim her for a bride

336b.description: B believed that her lover, A, was what he seemed to be, poor and humble; but he reveals himself as a man of wealth and station, incognito. * B, who considered A poor and humble, discovers that he is a man of wealth and station; and, oddly enough, in B’s mind A’s deception outbalances the wealth and rank, and she makes his high estate an obstacle to their love

336c.description: B, a white woman, is in love with A, also white. B-3, a woman of alien race, seeks to win A away from B

337a.description: A, in love with B, meets with misfortune when he leaves B for B-3, a woman who flatters his vanity

337b.description: A, engaged to marry B-3, abandons her and marries B * B-3 sues A for breach of promise **

347a.description: A, seeking to uphold a lofty conception of duty, secretly abandons B 23c 331 332, a woman whom he loves dearly * A’s enemy, A-3, as a means of persecution, by subtlity 348 compels A to marry B **

347b.description: A is compelled by F-B, father of B, to marry B * F-B believes he is fully warranted in compelling A, at the point of a gun, to marry B **

351a.description: A kidnaps his sweetheart, B, 284 300 while she is on her way to marry A-3, A’s rival in love, and marries her himself

351b.description: A and B, lovers, are innocently thrown into a compromising situation 134a, b 876b * A, in order to safeguard B’s good name, has a marriage ceremony performed by a wandering circuit rider, A-8 **

352a.description: A masquerades as a servant in the household of F-B, father of B, the girl he loves * A, enacting the role of a servant, rescues B from an accident by heroic bravery 181a -* 851a -* not at all in the manner of a menial ** A stands revealed as the lover of B whom F-B has not favored *** F-B approves of A, and A and B are married ****

352b.description: A rescues B, the woman he loves, from a villainous rival in love, A-3 154b. A marries B

354a.description: B, impelled by an unusual motive, invents a fictitious character, AX * AX, a fictitious character invented by B, “comes to life,” falls in love with B 4a ch A to AX 298 ch A to AX, and they marry **

354b.description: B must be married when she reaches a certain age if she would receive a rich inheritance * B has no lovers, but a “marriage of convenience” is arranged with A, on the understanding that it is to be secret, and that A is never to see B after the marriage **

360a.description: A, thinking his love rejected by B, receives a letter from B telling him how much she loves him, and that her father, F-B, has consented to their marriage

360b.description: A loves B, but he is uncertain of her affections and is too timid to propose marriage * A finds an object, X, which B has lost, an object that proves her love for him 165 ** A joyfully proposes to B and is accepted ***

361a.description: A proves false to B, the woman he loves, and has a disastrous affair with B-3 * B-3 abandons A after he loses his money 606 630 and is injured and sent to a hospital 655 710 ** B, still loyal, returns to A, and there is reconciliation and marriage ***

361b.description: A proves false to B, the love of his youth * A, middle-aged, goes searching for B, the sweetheart of his earlier years ** 205 A finds B patiently waiting for him, and they marry ***

363a.description: A revolts against opposing restrictions and achieves happiness in marriage with B

363b.description: A renounces an enterprise against F-B, father of B, the girl he loves, when F-B withdraws his objections to A as a son-in-law and allows him to marry B

leadIns: 245 ch A to B & A-3 to B-3
364a.description: B, a white woman, contemplates suicide when a mystery of her birth and parentage apparently yields an evil secret * A, B’s loyal lover, working in secret, secures proof of B’s unsullied lineage 1051 1052 -*; and they marry **

364b.description: B, in love with A and estranged from him, after various misadventures 82a 89 discovers that A still loves her * A reconciliation is effected, and they marry **

364c.description: A, with a taint of inferior blood in his veins, is in love with B, supposedly a white girl. He is about to give B up when he discovers that B also has a taint of inferior blood 255 tr A & B 1051 * A marries B **

364d.description: A, with the help of B, overcomes an ignoble weakness * A’s gratitude to B blossoms into love; and. when A is sure he has rehabilitated his character, he proposes marriage to B and is accepted **

365a.description: A and B, not in love with each other, nevertheless marry because it seems the logical outcome of their long, friendly association

365b.description: A and B, unknown to each other, in a spirit of fun at a masquerade ball, go through with a supposedly mock marriage ceremony. It later appears that the marriage was legal

365c.description: A is married to an unknown woman, BX, by an insane clergyman, A-8, at the point of a gun

365d.description: A marries BX, a woman he does not know * A and BX, husband and wife, go their different ways immediately after the marriage ceremony **

367a.description: B offers to marry A and, as his wife, help him to rebuild his wasted life

367b.description: B doubts A when he tells her he loves her; then, having convinced herself of A’s love 97 116, B accepts A and they are married

368a.description: B, having rejected A, the man she loves, because of an obligation she feels herself under to her father, F-B, is informed by F-B that he is going to be married—and B finds herself turned out on the world

368b.description: B marries wealthy A, a man she does not love, in order that she may have money with which to help a parent who is in desperate need

368c.description: B accepts her lover, A, and A secures a marriage license; then, before B and A can marry, B suddenly marries A-3, A’s rival in love

leadIns: 818d ch A to A-8 & CH to B
368d.description: B, a foundling, has the secret of her birth and parentage revealed to her by A. A rich estate awaits B’s claim and proof of parentage * A, in love with B, is poor and feels that he may not aspire to the hand of wealthy B; but B proposes marriage to A, and happiness is the result **

368e.description: A, unhappily married to B and in love with B-3, is too high-minded to seek a divorce * A’s unworthy wife, B, is killed in an accident, and A is free to marry B-3, whom he has long loved **

377a.description: A divorces his wife, B * B is devoted to A, and he owes much of his prosperity to her loyalty and shrewd advice **

377b.description: A marries B, thinking she is wealthy; after marriage, he discovers that B is not wealthy * A, bankrupt, divorces B and plans to marry wealthy B-3 ** B-3, whom A, divorced, seeks to marry, marries another man *** B, just divorced by A, falls heir to a large estate ****

385a.description: A and his wife, B, have frequent and violent quarrels * B is mysteriously murdered 387 and A, innocent, is suspected of the crime **

leadIns: 836 ch A to B & A-2 to B-2
385b.description: A is asked by B-2 a friend of his deceased wife, B, for a bundle of love letters which B-2 had given to B for safe-keeping * A, husband of B, suspects B of receiving love letters—and discovers that the letters were merely being held by B for B-2 for safe-keeping **

398a.description: B fancies herself neglected by her husband, A * A-3, the “other man,” appears and, by flattering married B, and sympathizing with her, causes her to imagine she is in love with him **

398b.description: B fancies herself neglected by her husband, A * B, in order to win back her husband, A’s, love by arousing his jealousy, flirts with A-3 **

411a.description: B, happily married to A, commits an indiscretion

411b.description: B, wife of A, secretly borrows money from her old lover, A-3, for a certain purpose * A-3 seeks to use his power over B to advance his own selfish aims **

422a.description: A secretly defrauds B of a large sum of money * A 701 ch A-2 to B marries B in order to make a crafty restitution of property which, before marriage, he had stolen from her **

carryOns: 1290b ch A to SN-A & F-A to A
422b.description: A has married B for her money * A, having secured B’s money, grows tired of her ** A tells B he is a criminal, and will presently be arrested by the police *** A induces B to enter into a suicide pact with him **** B, carrying out a suicide pact with A, kills herself; A does not kill himself, but craftily explains that B commited suicide *****

423a.description: A and B, man and wife, each secretly leaves home on the same day * A believes he has deserted B, and B believes she has deserted A **

423b.description: A and B, man and wife, are wealthy and socially popular * A and B are so occupied with social engagements that they have no time for the enjoyment of each other’s society ** A and B seek solitude where they can be alone together *** A and B find the solitude they crave in [1] a lonely lighthouse, [2] on a desert island or [3] by pretending they leave for an extended trip abroad, closing their magnificent home and living secretly in humble furnished quarters ****

429a.description: A, married to B, is impelled by an unusual motive to drop out of sight, lose his personality and go adventuring in the under-world

429b.description: A and B, married and devotedly in love with, each other, are impelled by an unusual motive to drop out of sight, leave the world they know and search for an environment more to their liking

432a.description: A, married to B, seeks by secret enterprise to effect a change in unpleasant marital conditions

432b.description: A’s wife, B, is a mystery woman * A does not know B, and has not seen her since the day of their romantic marriage **

433a.description: A’s enemy, A-3, who wronged A grievously, is dead * A seeks to revenge himself upon B, the wife of A-3, for a grievous wrong committed by A-3 **

433b.description: A’s wife, B, is loved by A-3 * A-3 seeks craftily to win B, the wife of A **

434a.description: A’s wife, B, seems to have an “affair” with another man, A-3 * A is manoeuvered by A-3 into gambling with money not his own, and losing it **

434b.description: A is craftily manoeuvered into misfortune by A-3 * A, in the power of A-3, is compelled to divorce his wife, B **

435a.description: A marries B, a woman who, unknown to A, is already married to A-3, a husband who is living and undivorced * A-2, a friend of A’s, sends A-3 to A, B’s second husband, and exposure of deceitful B follows **

435b.description: A’s wife, B, is untrue to him, a fact of which A is in ignorance. A-2 discovers B’s unfaithfulness, and informs A, who is on his death bed obstinately refusing treatment that would heal him * A, desperately ill, fired by tales of his wife, B’s, unfaithfulness, makes up his mind to live and takes treatment that cures him **

445a.description: B, wife of A, is mistakenly supposed by A to have an “affair” with A-3 * B, wife of A, detests A-3. but calls on him at his apartment at night 483b 583b ** B forces A-3, at the revolver point, to return to her money which he has taken craftily from A ***

445b.description: B, wife of A, seeks desperately to escape disaster * B drinks a potion which throws her into a condition resembling death, having been assured that A will appear and rescue her when she revives **

446a.description: B, wife of A, is guilty of an indiscretion * B, in order to escape consequences of personal culpability, falsely accuses innocent A-2 **

446b.description: B, wife of A, calls on her lover, A-2 * A calls on his friend, A-2 ** A-2 conceals B so A will not see her *** A discovers his wife, B, concealed in the apartment of his his friend, A-2 ****

455a.description: B secretly disposes of a dearly prized possession in order to buy her husband, A, a Christmas (or birthday or wedding anniversary) present

455b.description: B, and her husband, A, have fallen upon evil days * B, in order to “keep the wolf from the door,” finds work in a laundry, but tells A she is working as an “art director” **

458a.description: A and B, just married, start by train on their honeymoon * B, the bride, seeks to escape annoying experiences when A, the groom, leaving the train to send a telegram, is left behind **

458b.description: A and B, married, find themselves cast away among a strange, half-barbarian people * A, finding the beauty of his wife, B, a source of danger to himself, seeks to avoid the danger by a stratagem **

466a.description: B is married to A and they have one child, CH * B loves CH but she does not love A ** B loves A-3, and elopes with him, leaving her child, CH, with her husband, A ***

466b.description: B, young wife of elderly A, has an intrigue with a servant of A’s, A-7 * A is ill and about to die; B, his wife, could save him, but she will not **

476a.description: B, wife of A, is craftily persuaded by A-3, the “other man” in a “love triangle,” to elope with him

476b.description: B, wife of A, finds herself in the power of an old lover, A-3 * A-3 threatens to reveal to B’s husband, A, a fateful secret 441 447 455b 492b unless B will agree to a certain proposition A makes to her **

483a.description: B, wife of A, falls into misfortune * A-3, a man of evil character, seeks by violence and while intoxicated, to dishonor B, wife of A **

483b.description: B, wife of A, is by subtlity made a prisoner by A-3, a rejected lover, in his apartment

484a.description: A and B, man and wife, struggle to realize a cherished ideal * A and B discover that their cherished ideal is a mistaken one **

484b.description: A tries in vain to pay the debts incurred by his extravagant wife, B, whom he idolizes * A, facing ruin, seeks to save himself by committing a transgression **

486a.description: A, married to B, falls in love with B-3

486b.description: A has two wives, B and B-3, two homes several miles apart, two names by which he is known in two different communities, two circles of acquaintances, and practices two professions

488a.description: A marries B because he thinks she is poor * A discovers, after his marriage with B, that she is wealthy in her own right **

488b.description: A marries B, a woman he does not love * A has committed a transgression 1290a 1301 1304; B knows of the transgression, and A marries her in order to safeguard his evil secret **

490a.description: A and B, man and wife, keep themselves in poverty by spending  all their money for rich furnishings to put in a mansion they are going to build when they become wealthy * A and B keep themselves poor by buying rich furnishings for the mansion they are some day going to build; but the furnishings, inadequately housed, fall into ruin before A and B are able to build their air castle **

490b.description: A, and B, man and wife, are to inherit money from a rich relative, A-2, when a child shall bless their union * A and B, childless, write a rich relative, A-2, that a son has been born to them ** A-2 writes A and B that he is coming to see their child; and A and B find it necessary to resort to further simulation ***

491a.description: B is the wife of A, and loves him devotedly * B insists on dominating A in business affairs **

491b.description: B, wife of A, insists on living beyond her husband’s means * B, through fooiish extravagance, brings A close to ruin **

492a.description: B’s husband, A, loves her devotedly * A is of a parsimonious nature and gives B little money **

492b.description: B’s husband, A, is a poor man * B loves jewels and fine clothes which her husband, A, is unable to give her ** B is persuaded to accept a valuable piece of jewelry from an old admirer, A-3 *** B tells A, her husband, that a valuable piece of jewelry, given her by A-3, is set with imitation stones and that she bought it for herself ****

496a.description: A falls ill * A’s wife, B, from whom he is seeking a divorce, nurses him back to health **

496b.description: A’s wife, B, deserts him and obtains a divorce * A falls ill. B-3, who loved A before he married B, nurses A back to health **

496c.description: A, hen-pecked husband of B, discovers that B has an undivorced husband, A-3, living * A secretly abandons B and leaves her to A-3. B’s undivorced former husband **

499a.description: A and B, husband and wife, are estranged from each other * A and B, estranged, undergo a character transformation through love for their child, CH, and become reconciled **

499b.description: A dearly loves his wife, B, but B does not love him * A wins the love of his wife, B, by patience, forbearance, kindliness and devotion **

500a.description: A is seeking a divorce from B * A becomes reconciled with B when she nurses him through a serious illness **

500b.description: A, failing in business and almost a bankrupt, nevertheless marries B, a shrewd and thrifty woman * B so reorganizes and manages A’s affairs that he becomes prosperous **

503a.description: B’s husband, A, is brutal and tyrannical * B, married to brutal and tyrannical A, loves and is beloved by, A-3 **

503b.description: B discovers that her husband, A, is seeking the life of her lover, A-3 * B seeks desperately to save her lover, A-3, from the vengeance of her husband, A **

504a.description: B seeks to win her husband, A, to a certain enterprise * B, with the help of the elements during a devastating storm, succeeds in winning her husband, A, to an enterprise long cherished by B **

504b.description: B is the second wife of A * A’s sorrow for his deceased wife, B-3, causes B, his second wife, much unhappiness ** B, second wife of A, discovers that B-3, A’s first wife, was unfaithful ***

leadIns: 561 tr A & B, ch A-3 to B-3
506a.description: B thinks her husband, A, has committed a moral transgression 563a * B discovers through a friend, B-2, that the moral transgression of which she has accused her husband, A, was never committed **

506b.description: B, through false suspicion, is estranged from her husband, A * B becomes reconciled with her husband, A, when a suspicion is proved to be false **

507a.description: B is eloping with A-3, the man who destroyed her faith in her husband, A * B, wife of A, eloping with A-3, meets A-2, A’s friend, and is rescued by A-2 from an act of folly **

507b.description: B, married to A, elopes with A-3 * B’s love for her child, CH, left with her husband, A, when she deserted him, draws her back to CH and A **

519a.description: A learns that his wife, B, is in terrible danger * A, if he leaves his post of duty to save his wife, B, who is in terrible Hanger, will sacrifice lives and property he is in duty bound to safeguard **

519b.description: A, over the phone, receives an agonized call from his wife, B, for help. B is in terrible danger * A rescues B **

524a.description: A, husband of B, has a dangerously reckless passion for gambling in stocks * A, husband of B, is a lawyer with trust funds in his possession; and B fears that he will be tempted to use the trust funds for gambling purposes **

524b.description: A, elderly husband of youthful B, will die if a limb is not amputated * A refuses to have a limb amputated, preferring “to die in one piece.” B, his wife, upholds him in his determination **

529a.description: A, deeply in love with his wife, B, is made defendant in divorce proceedings started by B

529b.description: A dominates his wife, B, a nagger and a scold, by petty tyrannies that are more masterful than any B has at her command * B, when properly subdued by her husband, A’s, pretended tyrannies, finds A gentle, kindly and considerate ** A, by being cruel in order to be kind, insures the married happiness of himself and B ***

532a.description: B must have money in order to save her husband, A * A, husband of B, is desperately ill, and will die unless he can have a change of climate **

532b.description: B’s long, beautiful tresses are greatly admired by her husband, A * B, in order finance a certain enterprise involving her husband, A, sells her long hair **

539a.description: A, husband of B, is the victim of egotistical self-deception and thinks himself a great man * A believes that he is prevented from becoming famous by the jealousy of his wife, B **

539b.description: A reads in a newspaper that his wife, B, has divorced him * B divorces A on the grounds of desertion **

546a.description: B, wife of A, during A’s absence, sees destruction threatening A’s life work * B, at the cost of her own life, heroically saves from destruction the life work of her husband, A **

546b.description: B, homely, marries a blind man, A, who thinks her surpassingly beautiful * B hires a noted eye-specialist to perform an operation on the eyes of her blind husband, A. whereby A’s sight is restored **

548a.description: A, married to B, suffers a memory lapse and marries B-3 * A, husband of B, suffers an attack of amnesia and marries B-3; his memory returns, and he forgets B-3 and goes back to B **

548b.description: A is a bigamist; and his two wives, B and B-3, meet by chance and compare notes

552a.description: A, husband of B, discovers that B is unfaithful

552b.description: A finds a bundle of love letters in a locked drawer of his wife, B’s, desk—letters written after B’s marriage to him, but not by him * A, discovering that his wife, B, is unfaithful, strangles her while she sleeps **

555a.description: A abandons his loving, devoted wife, B, to elope with B-3, a younger and prettier woman * A, abandoning his wife, B, to elope with B-3, pays a penalty of remorse and unhappiness **

555b.description: A, unhappily married to B, falls in love with B-3, a girl much younger than himself * A, married to B and in love with B-3, takes a long journey in an attempt to forget B-3 **

557a.description: B’s husband, A, has a weak heart, and is lured into over-exertion by A-3, B permitting * A dies as the result of a conspiracy between B and A-3, and B suffers remorse **

557b.description: B, wife of A, elopes with A’s friend, A-2 * B, wife of A, and A-2 with whom B is eloping, meet death in an automobile accident **

563a.description: A, estranged from his wife, B, whom he dearly loves, seeks a reconciliation

563b.description: A marries B, a beautiful woman notorious for her vicious temper and scorpion tongue * A is deeply in love with his wife, B, a virago, and plans to transform her nature by a method of his own **

563c.description: A and B, man and wife, deplore the insincerity and the mercenary spirit of modern city life * A and B, man and wife, leave the city and search in the country for their ideal of what life should be ** A and B, man and wife, discover that they are searching for an ideal that does not exist ***

564a.description: B, young and attractive, has recently lost her husband, A * B, a young and attractive widow, resolves to remain faithful to the memory of her deceased husband, A, and never marry again **

564b.description: B, wishing to be free of her husband, A, writes anonymous “poison pen” letters regarding herself, and sends them to A * B writes anonymous “poison pen” letters regarding her husband, A, and sends them to herself **

566a.description: B seeks to aid her husband, A, who is morose and discontented

566b.description: B, fearing her husband, A, will commit a transgression, pretends herself to commit a transgression * B pretends to be a shoplifter, but has honestly purchased the goods which her horrified husband, A, finds in her possession **

568a.description: A, married to B, discovers the unfaithfulness of B * A, discovering that his wife, B, is unfaithful, kills her and himself **

568b.description: A seeks craftily to be revenged upon his wife, B, for falling in love with A-3, the man who has befriended her

carryOns: 594e ch A-5 to A & last A to A-3
568c.description: A, husband of B, discovers the unfaithfulness of B * A kills A-3, the lover of his wife, B **

568d.description: A, husband of B, attempts to kill B s lover, A-3 * A-3. murderously assaulted by A, husband of B, slays him in self-defense **

573a.description: A and B, for certain reasons, keep their marriage a close secret * B’s father, F-B, insists that B, already united to A by a secret marriage, shall marry A’s rival in love, A-3 **

573b.description: A, missing and supposed to be dead, returns secretly and finds his wife, B, married to A-3 * A, discovering that his wife, B, dearly loves A-3, whom she has married thinking A to be dead, secretly goes away and takes himself out of her life **

574a.description: A, a toiler, seeks to support his wife, B, and family by honest enterprise; but he is out of work, his wife is ill and his family in need

574b.description: A, husband of B, is in dire financial straits * A, and his wife, B, are compelled to live with A’s mother, M-A, and avail themselves of her slender resources **

576a.description: A suffers overwhelming sorrow because of the death of his wife, B * A’s sorrow over the death of his wife, B, culminates in hallucination **

576b.description: A, mistakenly supposing his beloved wife, B, is dead, kills himself * B, discovering that her husband, A, is dead, commits suicide **

578a.description: A, because of the death of his wife, B, suffers great sorrow and undergoes a character transformation

578b.description: A’s wife, B, dies. B, A’s wife, on her death bed, has A promise that he will marry B-3, B’s best friend * B-3 loved A before he married B **

579a.description: B is convinced that all the misfortunes of herself and her husband, A, are due to A’s irreligious nature

579b.description: A’s wife, B, is racially, morally and mentally A’s inferior * B, wife of A, proves a hindrance to him socially and in a business way **

583a.description: B, if discovered doing something she has in mind, will find herself at odds with her husband, A

583b.description: B, wife of A, is desperately in need of money for a certain purpose * A-3, a rejected lover of B’s, promises to help B, wife of A, if she will come to his apartment for an interview **

583c.description: B, wife of A, is desperately in need of money for a certain purpose * B, wife of A, happens to meet an old lover, A-3, and is forced to borrow a sum of money from him **

584a.description: B, just married to A, discovers in a secret place her obituary notice (written by A?) the date of demise alone left blank

584b.description: B, wife of A, loses her love for A when she discovers his cowardly nature

585a.description: B, wife of A, leaves home suddenly on important business while A is absent * B, leaving home suddenly during the absence of her husband, A, writes a line to A explaining her departure, but the wind whisks the note out of an open window and away. B’s absence is accounted a mysterious disappearance **

585b.description: B, wife of A, is a butterfly of fashion * B, wife of A, must have rich clothes and luxurious surroundings in order to be happy **

594a.description: B, undemonstrative in her affections, surprises her husband, A, and arouses his suspicion by bringing his breakfast to him in bed

594b.description: B, a termagant, supposes herself a widow and marries A * A-3. B’s undivorced husband, appears secretly to A, B’s present husband, and tries craftily to get A to pay him money for not claiming B as his wife **

594c.description: B divorces her husband, A, and is awarded the custody of their child, CH * A steals his child, CH, from his divorced wife, B **

594d.description: B, wife of A, innocently commits a transgression * A, in order to save his wife, B, declares that he is guilty of a transgression committed by B **

594e.description: B, wife of A, takes the law in her own hands and shoots A-5, who has murdered A

594f.description: B, wife of A, dons the mask and custom of B-3, A’s paramour, and meets A as B-3 at a masquerade ball

leadIns: 475 ch A to A-2 & B to B-2
510 ch A to A-2 & B to B-2
594g.description: B uses her weird powers of mental telepathy in reshaping the destiny of an unhappily married couple, A-2 and B-2 * B, having succeeded in reconciling A-2 and B-2, married and estranged from each other, discovers herself to be in love with A-2 **

603a.description: A suffers defeat because his friend, A-2, does not efficiently carry out his part in a certain enterprise

603b.description: A and his friend, A-2, are attacked by robbers in a lonely wood * A’s friend, A-2, receives a wound from which he dies **

603c.description: A and his friend, A-2, on horseback, are swimming a flooded river. A-2 is struck by a piece of floating drift, but A rescues him and gets him to the river bank * A-2 is so badly injured that he dies **

603d.description: A and his friend, A-2, are wandering afoot in the desert. A-2 is injured and their water supply fails * A’s friend, A-2, dies from injuries and hardships **

611a.description: A’s youthful escapades, committed thoughtlessly and not with malice, constitute the wrong which has given him a bad name among the people of his native place

611b.description: A induces his father, F-A, to advance him his patrimony * A leaves his native place, squanders his substance in riotous living, comes to want and experiences remorse **

652a.description: A is caught in an unpleasant complication, and disaster threatens him unless he is crafty enough to devise plans for his own safety

652b.description: A, the idol of his people, is about to lose a wrestling match to A-3, his rival * A, wrestling in the open with A-3, a rival wrestler, prevents A-3 from winning a victory by falling from a cliff, apparently by accident, and losing his life **

660a.description: A, a professional man, is captured in his office at night by mysterious strangers, A-4, A-4, A-4, blindfolded and taken to a secret place * A, spirited away by A-4. A-4, A-4, is compelled to perfom a professional service **

660b.description: A, captured by enemies of B, is threatened with death by A-5 in an attempt to extort from him a secret of B’s * A, threatened with death by A-5 in an attempt to force him to reveal a secret of B’s, defies A-5 to do his worst **

680a.description: A was in the World War * Before the World War, A was a successful business man; after the war, a physical wreck, and a bankrupt **

680b.description: A undertakes an enterprise when he is prosperous; and then, suffering loss and becoming a bankrupt and a cripple, he has not the heart to go on with the enterprise

681a.description: A, happy and optimistic, undergoes a critical illness which makes of him a morbid, melancholy, superstitious pessimist

681b.description: A undergoes a critical illness * A recovers from a critical illness but loses all remembrance of his personal identity **

695a.description: A’s neighbors persist in thinking A guilty of a crime for which he was tried and acquitted * A, tried for a crime and acquitted seeks happiness in freedom from suspicion **

695b.description: A suffers imprisonment for a crime he did not commit * A, finishing a term of imprisonment for a crime he did not commit, finds that his character as an ex-convict seriously hampers him in his honest enterprises **

697a.description: A’s parents, F-A and M-A, insist that he study to be a doctor, while all his soul is yearning to make another profession his life work

leadIns: 818c ch A to A-8 & CH to A
818d ch A to A-8 & CH to A
697b.description: A is a foundling who knows nothing of his birth and parentage * A knows nothing of his birth and parentage, and he finds this a serious and humiliating handicap **

699a.description: A is a fugitive from justice, who discovers that a relative, A-8, has died and left him a rich estate * A is a fugitive from justice who dares not show himself to receive a rich estate that has been left to him, for he knows he will be arrested **

699b.description: A, driven to bay by pursuers, takes refuge in an old house * A is rescued from pursuers, A-6, A-6, when the old house in which he has taken refuge is blown away by a tornado **

706a.description: A, an engineer, has flung a span of steel across a mountain gap, backing his ingenuity and judgment with a bridge in a spot where other engineers have declared no bridge is possible * A’s life work, nearing completion, is threatened with destruction by a great storm **

706b.description: A, a scientist, has spent years in research work and has the result of his labors in manuscript form * A’s priceless manuscript is threatened with destruction by fire **

706c.description: A is an artist who has spent years painting a certain picture which he considers his life work * A’s life work is threatened with destruction by a mob during a political outbreak **

carryOns: 875a tr A & A-2 and eliminate “prison cell”
711a.description: A, engaged in an important enterprise, suddenly finds himself in quarantine because of an outbreak of a contagious disease

711b.description: A, engaged in an important enterprise, becomes involved in an automobile accident * A is removed in an unconscious condition from the scene of an accident ** A loses an important object, X. on the scene of an accident ***

711c.description: A, seeking to carry out an important enterprise, meets with obstacles that defeat his plans

715a.description: A, wealthy and influential, loses his clothes, personal belongings and all other means of identification 658 * A, wealthy, finds that his pretentions to place and power are treated as a joke ** A cannot convince others of his identity, and undergoes the hardships and evil treatment accorded an upstart imposter ***

715b.description: A cripples himself for life in rescuing a child, CH, from death 842b * A loses his small fortune in trying to help a friend, A-2 601 ** A, a poor man and crippled, finds his life in a sad tangle ***

715c.description: A is found guilty of a political conspiracy 793b * A, convicted of being a traitor to his country, is expatriated and forced to live abroad **

718a.description: A knows something others do not know, something that proves the greatest obstacle to his enterprising and capable nature 1061 * A, believed by all to be a white man, knows there is negro blood in his veins **

leadIns: 928b -* ch SN to A & A to A-8
718b.description: A is a youth who, sheltered from the world and pampered by doting parents, has no true conception of life and no ability to face its rugged issues * A, callow and inefficient, learns some real truths through hard experience **

719a.description: A disappears mysteriously * A, set upon by mysterious persons, AX, AX, AX. in the cellar of his own home, is spirited away through a concealed passage **

719b.description: A, passenger on a vessel on the high seas, is made a prisoner when the vessel is captured by mutineers, A-5, A-5, A-5 * A, captured by mutineers, A-5, A-5, A-5, is placed in a small boat and cast adrift on the high seas **

726a.description: A, a matador, is getting ready in his room to appear in the bull ring * A, making ready to undertake an enterprise, has his plans suddenly interfered with **

726b.description: A, ill, and worn by a long journey, is suddenly called upon to undertake an enterprise which would be difficult if he were physically at his best

737a.description: B is greatly discontented because of an unfortunate state of affairs * B, discontented, seeks to gain contentment, but the obstacles seem insuperable **

737b.description: B, in a large city hotel, returns at night from her bath and, through error, enters through an unlocked door into a room which proves to be not her own * B finds that the knob and lock on the door of a hotel room are in disrepair: the lock apparently locks itself, and the knob will not turn **

737c.description: B, near-sighted, unsophisticated, on leaving her room in a big city hotel, ties a black ribbon to the doorknob so she can easily find the door on her return * CH, a child, playing in the corridor of a big city hotel, transfers a black ribbon from the knob of B’s door to that of A **

743a.description: B becomes the victim of such desperate misfortunes that she plans to take her own life * B writes a letter explaining her reasons for committing suicide **

743b.description: B commits a transgression. B, in order to escape the consequences of a transgression, flees secretly to a distant place and assumes a fictitious name

761a.description: A, through the influence of a reckless friend, A-2, comes to his death

761b.description: A removes a birthmark from the beautiful face of his wife, B, with chemicals * A, seeking to help B, falls into tragic error **

770a.description: A is heavily in debt * A, in order to secure money to pay off his pressing obligations, leaves home to take a position at a distance; and he leaves suddenly and mysteriously without telling his creditors he is going **

770b.description: A, heavily in debt, seeks to save himself from ruin by forging the name of a friend, A-2, to a note

770c.description: A, heavily in debt, seeks to save himself by fraudulently using trust funds in his possession

771a.description: A thinks a certain crime has been committed and lodges information with the police, A-6 * A thinks a crime has been committed, but he is mistaken **

771b.description: A finds a paper containing the signals of his football team * A finds and keeps an incriminating document, X, with the intention of discovering the author of it at a later time ** A is accused of transgression by his rival, A-3, and an incriminating paper, X, is found in his possession ***

790a.description: A, before the war, had a friend, A-2, who had rendered him a very great service * A-2, during the war, is captured as an enemy spy and brought before Captain A ** Captain A allows an enemy spy, A-2, to escape, and ever afterward is regarded as a traitor to his country ***

790b.description: A, a judge, has a friend, A-2, brought before him for trial and sentence * A, a judge, presiding at the trial of his friend, A-2, so manipulates proceedings in favor of A-2 that A-2 is acquitted ** A, a judge, proving false to his high duty, ever afterwards bears a “crooked” reputation ***

792a.description: B mistakenly supposes A to be a thief when he restores to her an object, X, which she has lost * A, restoring to B an object, X, which she has lost, mistakenly supposes her to be a thief because X seems too valuable to be honestly owned by one in B’s straitened circumstances **

792b.description: B places an identifying mark on the door of her hotel room. The mark is changed in an unusual manner to another door; and B-8, occupant of the other room, is found to have been murdered

793a.description: A is persuaded by his friend, A-2, to engage in an enterprise * A is persuaded by his friend, A-2, to undertake an enterprise which A knows to be extremely difficult and which his judgment warns him to let alone **

793b.description: A is influenced by his friend, A-2, to take charge of some important papers * A, obliging his friend, A-2, by taking charge of some secret docurnents, is arrested, and accused on the strength of the documents, of having a part in a criminal conspiracy **

802a.description: A discovers that B, supposed to have been murdered, really committed suicide

802b.description: A discovers that B, supposed to have committed suicide, was really murdered

803a.description: A discovers that a cororner’s verdict of “accidental death” should have been one of cold, premeditated murder

803b.description: A, in desperate need, discovers that a gem, X, which he supposed to be worthless, is in reality genuine and immensely valuable

808a.description: A takes possession of B’s property in order to save it for her * A, taking possession of B’s property in order to save it for her, is falsely suspected by B of trying to steal it **

leadIns: 747 ch A to B & A-2 to B-2
808b.description: A is older and more experienced than B and seeks to advise her wisely and help her avoid making mistakes * B resents the superior attitude assumed by A **

812a.description: B, sympathetic and generous, befriends a needy stranger, A-4 * B, through befriending a needy stranger, A-4, becomes involved in an unpleasant complication **

leadIns: 982a ch A to F-B & NW to A
812b.description: B’s father, F-B, fails in his attempt to subdue and control A, a “wild” and unmanageable youth left in his charge * B, when her father, F-B, fails in an enterprise, takes the enterprise off his hands **

leadIns: 890 ch B to A-4 & A-4 to A
815a.description: A is overtaken by A-4, a fugitive who is being pursued by A-6, an officer of the law * A’s sympathy goes out to A-4, a fugitive from the law, and he attempts to rescue him **

carryOns: 821 ch A to F-A & SN to A
815b.description: A, a dissolute son, in want, returns to his home and his father, F-A, a better and a wiser man than when he went away * A, a dissolute son, is freely forgiven his transgressions by his father, F-A **

816a.description: A is on his way to keep an important engagement * A finds a stranger, A-4, ill, exhausted and unconscious, lying in the road ** A subordinates his own affairs to those of a stranger, A-4, who is ill, and helps him to a place where he can receive medical attention ***

816b.description: A’s friend, B, is in a foreign country, alone, homesick and discouraged * B, in a foreign country, unexpectedly meets A, a friend from “home” **

carryOns: 870b ch A-6 to A & A-5 to A-4
